story:
How SaveAWattHour's story began

Weren't it for the increasing costs of energy in your home would you still care for reducing the consumption in order to protect the environment? SaveAWattHour achieves both equally important objectives, be it from a financial or an eco-friendly perspective.

The idea for SaveAWattHour has been driven by Marc's increasing interest in promoting energy awareness ever since his involvement in various Smart Grid activities and projects in the Los Angeles area as a postdoc research associate at USC. Current solutions are automated without the possibility to learn and take smart personalized decisions. SaveAWattHour does just that! It relies on publicly available weather forecasts for the upcoming 24hrs in order to intelligently determine the best way of reducing consumption without impacting your comfort by considering your appliances and billing model. If funded, future versions will incorporate more accurate sensors such as luminosity, movement, temperature, and humidity, to name a few.

Marc's passion for smart yet easy-to-use technologies has been fueled by his vast IT expertise especially in designing and programming Cloud oriented solutions. His initial ideas helped shape the prototype App currently available on Google Play and the www.saveawatthour.com website where people around the world can take action(s) and see how their small contributions reflect worldwide.


Through your combined efforts made possible by taking small individual actions we can make a big difference both for ourselves in terms of budget spent and carbon footprint and for utilities by reducing their generation costs and thus environmental impact. Saving a watt is less costly than producing it!

Why your contribution is so important

Building such a complex software and networked sensor infrastructure requires hundreds of hours, thousands of dollars, and sustained effort from our side. We are in an early stage of development so any help will be greatly appreciated and wisely used. Our plan is to gather sufficient venture capital to kick-off our own R&D start-up in Romania due to low production costs. Your contributions will enable us to continue the App development by offering an improved user experience and more accurate recommendations based on low cost yet accurate sensors for everyone's budget.

Since we have voluntarily designed and built the prototype App and website in our spare time, we would like to first recover our initial expenses totaling $2,100. These cover the website domain acquisition and user interface, Android App graphics (including logo), Google Play listing fee, smart sensors, and advertisement campaigns expenses. Part of these funds will be used to further improve the user interface.

We are offering great perks in return of your contribution!

Eventually we would like to raise $65,000 to fund our startup during its first year. This is a lot of money but a way less than what would be needed in Western Europe or US for the same kind of effort. The funds will help us design, implement, and test the next versions of SaveAWattHour by adding sensors and smart appliances that will enable a true personalized experience. We are also planning a utility oriented version where data driven recommendations based on machine learning techniques will be used to enable an intelligent selection of customers to target during an energy reduction event. The figure below depicts each version's features in detail:

From the budget needed for the first year 95.4% represents:

- Salaries for two computer programmers, one electrical engineer, and one marketing and sales specialist. A freelance graphics designer fee is also included here;

- Costs for office rent and associated utility bills;

- Traveling to promote the product and establish contacts with investors and partners;

- Acquisition of necessary IT equipment.

The remaining 4.6% is for Indiegogo campaign marketing and incentives.

By raising only $45,000 we will be able to support a team of one programmer and one electrical engineer to design the software and sensor interfaces (movement, luminosity, temperature, humidity, etc.) for the upcoming versions.

Only $35,000 will allow us to hire them for 6 months with just a subset of sensors being incorporated and tested.

What you give goes back to you

In the end all your investment will return to YOU by benefiting from this state-of-the-art piece of technology!

Your involvement impacts the world

In 2012 and 2013 approximately 19% of the worldwide energy consumption came from renewable sources, that is wind, solar, geothermal, and biomasses. Current projections indicate that by 2040 80% of world energy use will continue to come from fossil fuels. By burning fossil fuels our power plants contribute partially to global warming, acid rain, and oil spillage. All these impact our and our children's health by inhaling their toxic by-products. The time has never been better to take action! Your everyday contribution may be small but not insignificant if you act now! Small actions for reducing energy consumption will not affect your lifestyle but will for sure make a difference.

SaveAWattHour not only helps reducing energy consumption but also contributes to educating people in becoming responsible in using the planet's non-renewable resources. In doing so it raises people's awareness on the environment and also enables utilities to cut production costs.

The success of similar approaches has been previously proven in projects in which Marc has participated as manager and technical IT lead. For the USC campus for instance, energy reduction strategies have showed that by intelligently controlling and selecting HVAC units up to 9% can be saved during peak hours. The success of these methods will enable them to be adapted for the greater LA DWP Smart Grid Demonstration Project. Through SaveAWattHour, Marc and his team intend to bring some of the knowledge and techniques to the general public through easy-to-use technologies at affordable prices by offering both consumer and utility oriented solutions.

You can always help by spreading the word!

Your support in any ways is very much appreciated. Help us build a strong community of supporters by sharing this campaign and promoting it on your favorite social network. If you do link back to our campaign and to http://www.saveawatthour.com.

 by inhaling their toxic by-products. The time has never been better to 
take action! Your everyday contribution may be small but not 
insignificant if you act now! Small actions for reducing energy consumption will not affect your lifestyle but will for sure make a difference.
SaveAWattHour not only helps reducing energy consumption but also contributes to educating people in becoming responsible in using the planet's non-renewable resources. In doing so it raises people's awareness on the environment and also enables utilities to cut production costs.
The success of similar approaches has been previously proven in projects in which Marc has participated as manager and technical IT lead. For the USC campus for instance, energy reduction strategies have showed that by intelligently controlling and selecting HVAC units up to 9% can be saved during peak hours. The success of these methods will enable them to be adapted for the greater LA DWP Smart Grid Demonstration Project. Through SaveAWattHour, Marc and his team intend to bring some of the knowledge and techniques to the general public through easy-to-use technologies at affordable prices by offering both consumer and utility oriented solutions.
 You can always help by spreading the word!

Your support in any ways is very much appreciated. Help us build a strong community of supporters by sharing this campaign and promoting it on your favorite social network. If you do link back to our campaign and to http://www.saveawatthour.com.

story:
"He is the one we proclaim, admonishing and teaching everyone with
all wisdom so that we may present everyone fully mature in Christ".
                                                                                       - Colossians 1:28 NIV

GOSBEL will be the latest tool to help many Christians around the world to share Gospel. It is convenient, advantageous and blended-in for daily usage. Combines with the latest smartphone technology, GOSBEL can help you sharing the Gospel to all of your visitors to your home and office in an unprecedented way.

Despite the conveniences and efficiency that today’s advanced information technology have brought us, one downside seems to be the adverse effect on our interpersonal relationships. Sharing the Gospel with others has also become harder.

GOSBEL is an innovative product that combines the latest technology doorbell technology with sharing the Gospel to others. Simple yet amazing, GOSBEL requires only a light touch and shows every visitor to the door the grace of God and Christ.


PRODUCT FEATURES

Answer the door with your smartphone

Geographical distance is no longer a barrier! By connecting your smartphone to the GOSBEL via the internet, not only that notifications will be sent to your phone whenever visitors ring at the door; it also allows you to speak with them through the camera on GOSBEL. You can answer your door wherever you are!


Sharing the Gospel with high security

The GOSBEL uses a secure yet unique Gospel Password System that allows you to personalize the password using your preferred Bible verse number or color combinations. It also has an inbuilt smart card reader that provides a secure way to open your front door or gate in combination with the "Heaven's ID" smart card that comes with every GOSBEL.

It has a multi-coloured touchscreen that allows users to input their password, and can also preset to display a selection of Bible verses to visitors at the door.


Suitable to be used at many places

From homes to offices, upper floor shops to organizations such as churches, GOSBEL is great to share the Gospel anytime, anywhere.


Easy installation

GOSBEL is only 86mm X 86mm - small, compact, easy to install and fits most households.


Ideal gift for loved ones

Each GOSBEL is neatly packaged and is the perfect gift for your friends, church members or anyone else who needs a new doorbell! 



PRODUCT DETAILS

Designed and manufactured by Decoris, GOSBEL comes in 2 different versions - "Lifestyle Wireless" and "Smart Creation" to suit different needs.


Smart Creation GOSBEL

Packed with the components of the Standard Network Version, this version of GOSBEL also features the Bible verse Access control using your preferred Bible verse number or the colour combination code as your password. The “Heaven’s ID card” that comes with the GOSBEL works as a security smart card to maximize security when entering your home or office.

Download the free apps onto your smartphone and connect the GOSBEL onto the WIFI after installation. Your phone and the doorbell will be able to communicate as long as network is available.

  • Intelligent doorbell with mobile video intercom
  • Preset Christian hymns as doorbell ringtones
  • Doorbell interface includes Bible verse screensave, Bible Chapter & Verse password and Color Security Codes
  • WIFI/ Network Cable
  • Door can be answered on personal smartphone (as long as network is available)
  • Security camera enclosed
  • Security smart card system enabled (Smart Church Version ONLY)
  • Free applications for download from Apple store or Play store

Smart Creation GOSBEL


PRODUCT DEVELOPMENT & 
PRODUCTION TIMELINE



HELP US SHARE BLESSINGS, TOO!

We are aspired to use our talents received from God to share the Gospel with others around the world through the GOSBEL, and that they will come to know Him and be filled with His blessings.

So do please spread the word about our great products and aspirations both online and offline, to your church, family and friends, too!


FAQs - Frequently Asked Questions


1. Is the GOSBEL easy to install?

Yes, GOSBEL is designed most likely for DIY users, "Smart Creation GOSBEL" needs to be connected with 12VDC power supply and other cables for lock control.

2. How does the GOSBEL communicate with my smartphone?

The GOSBEL communicates to your smartphone using a software, that can be downloaded from Google Play Store or the Apple Store. After downloading and installing it on your smartphone, you will be able to see visitors on your phone using the App.

3. Which mobile device is suitable to connect with GOSBEL?

Both iOS and Android mobile devices are compatible with the GOSBEL. You would need to visit our website and download the App so to enable connections between the GOSBEL and your smartphone. 

4. Can GOSBEL provide the update software?

The GOSBEL will automatically inform you by on the GOSBEL screen and to your phone the when it detects an updated version which is available for download.

5. Does GOSBEL require a mobile SIM card to get connected?

No mobile SIM card is required. The GOSBEL connects directly to your existing home or office network either via hardwired network cable or WIFI connection.

6. Can GOSBEL be paired up with other hardware?

The GOSBEL compatible with all series of Decoris products such as home automation and indoor intercom unit. Please visit our website http://de.cor.is for more details.

7. What are the warranty terms?

Each GOSBEL comes with a One Year Warranty that covers free replacement including all parts, regardless if it is damages caused by man or natural disasters. 

8. Does the GOSBEL provide any other technical support?

You are welcome to contact our customer service for any enquiries. We will continue to better our services and will provide you a nearest local agents and distributors in regions outside of Hong Kong.


THE MASTERMIND OF GOSBEL


Find out more

Website
www.gosbel.org

Youtube
https://www.youtube.com/watch?v=T8DdIeC4oIM

Facebook
https://www.facebook.com/gosbelhk

story:
What is Car Caddie?

Car Caddie is a specially created patent pending foam used to QUICKLY and EASILY eliminate dirt and dust off of any car dashboard, golf ball, laptop, and in fact, most surfaces. It truly is AMAZING! It is exceptionally LIGHTWEIGHT, PORTABLE and MACHINE WASHABLE. You can put it in your bag, in your purse, and even in your pocket. Also, with Car Caddie's UNIQUE property it provides a grippy surface to place items like cell phones and eyeglass/sun glass cases. It is extremely durable and very flexible.

KEEPS DASHBOARDS DUST FREE


Car Caddie dusts and cleans a variety of surfaces, even golf balls. This special foam is light weight and durable. You can put it in your pocket or hang it on your belt loop, it never gets in the way.

NO MORE BULKY TOWELS OR DUSTERS


Car Caddie eliminates unwanted pet hair and lint from clothing and fabric without damage.

NO MORE PET HAIR AND LINT


Typical rubber sticky pads used in cars to rest cell phones and sun glass cases are too sticky. When you place your cell phone on the sticky pad and try to remove it, the pad comes off with the cell phone. Also, over time the sticky surface gathers too much dust and loses its stickiness. You will never have these issues with Car Caddie.

   PROVIDES A GRIPPY NOT STICKY SURFACE


Car Caddie comes without a hole so you can leave it on your dashboard or on your dusty desk, or it comes with a hole so you can attach it to your golf bag or belt loop.

Your Partnership:

If you are like our family you are constantly trying to keep things clean, especially for the kids. We are very confident that Car Caddie is the quick and easy solution in the fight against dust. That is why we need your support to launch this new effective product. Your support will go towards the manufacturing, packaging, and shipping of the Car Caddie. Part of your support will also go towards the development of new uses for this special foam. We are confident that you will enjoy this product. With your partnership we can make sure you will always have a place to put your cell phone and a clean dashboard. Thank you for looking into our project. We truly appreciate your time.

We welcome any feedback; especially those that could help enhance the product or find a new function.

The Car Caddie Journey:

I have been a serial entrepreneur all my life. I was always looking for simple products that would help people resolve some difficulties, or just make life a little easier and fun. I was working on hypoallergenic foam that removes sand off of the body at the beach, for many years. As I was testing different densities, shapes, sizes, and textures of foam, I discovered this particular foam, which I fell in love with, immediately. The texture, flexibility, property, and the overall quality of the foam were captivating. I realized it had many distinctive and amazing functional attributes. I then started the arduous task of testing and retesting this remarkable foam, in order to perfect the density, use, and function. There were many hurtles along this journey like figuring a way to bring my product to patent and finding someone to manufacture it, but all the work paid off. After, years of working with unique foams, I proudly bring you Car Caddie.  

An Idea is Born:

Brainstorming with a thin piece of foam in my hand, I was on the way to the office one morning and as usual I picked up a cup of coffee. I always hated driving with my cell phone in my pocket because it was very uncomfortable, so I had my cell phone in the cup holder. With the foam in my hand and the cell phone in the cup holder, I just casually threw the foam onto the dashboard. It landed on the curved part of the passenger side dashboard and it stuck there. The light went on, I knew exactly what to do with the cell phone needing the cup holder for my coffee. When I was exiting my car and reached over to grab my cell phone and the foam, I noticed the area where the foam was sitting was cleared of dust. I proceeded to dust off the dashboard and the adventure began. I have really committed myself to this project and really hope that the Car Caddie will bring a little joy and cleanliness into your life.

RISK AND CHALLENGES:

1. There is a production quantity minimum due to the nature of the foam and the difficulty of manufacturing. That minimum can be satisfied if there is a commitment for at least 5,000 pieces. If the 5,000 piece minimum is not fulfilled production may be delayed.

2. It is foam and like most foams it does absorb moister. When moister is absorbed it temporarily losses it's shape. When dried the shape is reestablished. Customers need to be patient and allow for the foam to dry.

3. It is not a sponge and using it as a sponge is a misuse of the product.

TO HELP SUPPORT US:

We know that not all people can contribute to our product monetarily, so spreading our product word of mouth would be greatly appreciated. Please, use the Indiegogo share tools to spread the word. Thank you from The Caddie family.

Car Caddie Maintenance:

Car Caddie Dimensions: 4 inch X 4 inch X 1/4 inch

After you dust off your dashboard, you can shake off the dust. If the dust is too excessive, you need to rub the dust off. It will not function properly as a grippy surface if you do not remove the excess dust.

Car Caddie is easily washable. Run it under water, then just let it dry and it will go back to it's original shape and use. You can even put it in the dryer on low heat.

Production Time Line:

OCTOBER & NOVEMBER - Indiegogo Launch

DECEMBER - Order Collection and Preparation

JANUARY - Pre-Production Run

FEBRUARY & MARCH - Car Caddie Production

APRIL & MAY - Assembly and Shipping

OUR PROMISE:

The Caddie family consists of serial entrepreneurs who enjoy fun, life, and reliable products. Our passion is for faith, family, community, and life. We know that Car Caddie in itself will not change your life, but through the success of Car Caddie we are pledging a minimum of 10% of all profits to help support families in need. We are just regular people who in some small way want to make a difference. We really need your support to make this happen and for the product to work. We thank you so much for your interest in Car Caddie and us.

Once Car Caddie gets on it's way we will keep you appraised of who we are supporting one family at a time.

story:
The principles of Best Frame Shops have a combined 50 years of experience in dealing with fine and rare art as well as museum caliber custom framing.
The principle acquired a small San Diego art and framing operation in 2013 after operating one of the largest galleries in a large eastern city for many years. 

The chief technician is a meticulous craftsman with 20 years of experience in a vast array of fabrication skills that many sales persons in the big box stores have never heard of.

While his skills can't cover all the anticipated fabrication needs of the company, his ability to train others and set quality standards is essential to growing this business.

The art operations of the gallery continues as dealing in rare and fine art can be done in the age of the internet almost anywhere. However the framing operation evolved in an entirely unexpected manner.  

Most of the retail framing customers that we met were looking for an alternative to the big box national brands. They wanted a more personalized, professional service, faster turnaround than could be found in remotely serviced "stores" along with reasonable prices and quality workmanship all of  which they found seriously lacking at the big box stores.

Perhaps more surprising, the best employees of the big box stores came by looking for employment.  Many of these employees had artistic backgrounds, which is a particularly fragile vocation, and were all too easily manipulated by the Wall St. run firms to accept anything in their field meaning low wages, part time benefit free work and impossible scheduling.
 

Kicking this around we realized that this corporate model was all too often seen in America in recent years. Big investment funds, usually handling money for wealthy individuals would set up well funded businesses which outsourced their suppliers to get very low prices and then hire low paid domestic employees to sell them.  The profits were often kept offshore and the owners were paid in low or no tax dollars using various offshore and other tax avoidance strategies which the Wall St. investment banks specialize in.  The Wall Street off shore model dominates most brands and it is no accident that they have a competitive advantage as they keep most of their costs at bare minimums to maximize profits.
And this model was seen in the picture framing industry as practiced in the big box stores as well. 

 It seemed to us that another model could be developed where employees could earn middle class wages with basic 21st century benefits like health insurance and earned leave if the profits were not siphoned off by various financial strategies engineered by Wall St. financiers. Shareholders would benefit as well if corporate earnings were sent directly to the stockholders instead of passing through the sticky hands of Wall Street.  And, it seems to us,  an unusual confluence of circumstances exists in this industry that makes it possible for these benefits to be realized with the the Best Frame Shops model as there is little comparable competition in this market

 

First, efficiencies made possible by technological advances means more productive employees who can then be paid more. Well paid employees are loyal employees with an interest in producing a mistake free product, always the achilles heel of custom made goods.  With demographic shifts favoring home ownership spending over the next 40 years there is a substantial and growing market to be tapped. And today where there is only a declining number of independents and and increasing number of omnibus big box retailers there is a unique opportunity to establish a preeminent specialized brand with all the competitive advantages that entails.

 Second, computer assisted design and fabrication means reduced training requirements.  Instead of learning demanding hand-to-eye related skills in cutting and fitting materials to exacting tolerances, the machine can do it first time, every time  to exacting measurements.   A key strategy of the company is to integrate and localize production so that every sales outlet can also produce a high quality final custom product and that requires trained employees with the necessary skills to get jobs done quickly and error free.   Computer assisted craftsmanship means employees can be trained and plugged in quickly and profitably wherever needed.  

Third, multiple professionally staffed locations drive marketing costs down per sales dollar. In today's world there is nothing that is more critical to brand establishment than saturation marketing.  Saturation marketing becomes cost effective when the cost is divided up among multiple units. Conversely the more you market, the more you are likely to be judged by ubiquitous consumer reviews which are increasingly the basis of consumer purchasing decisions.  Brands with quality control problems can't thrive. Our quality control experience has yielded a steady stream of very favorable reviews.  And key to quality control is computer assisted production, monitoring and control strategies. 

Our current operating situation is not conducive to growth and expansion.  However the basic premise of our business plan is born out by test advertising campaigns that have generated more demand than we can handle.  So our first objective is to move into a more suitable physical space closer to our target demographic base and set up the brand prototype unit.

Our budget is roughly broken down into 4 basic components.

     $25,000 for facility acquisition and leasehold improvements.

     $37,500  for Inventory expansion and product diversification.

         $37,500 for new equipment including custom engineered robotic machines.

       $37,500 for intensive marketing in the first year to establish proof of concept and the basis for further expansion.

Our primary priority is to open an appropriate facility to allow us to operate at the scale we need to achieve maximum traction in the industry. In the event we do not receive our full funding in the initial campaign, we will use available funding to set up the physical prototype operation and then revisit funding services to obtain the needed funds to achieve our prototype operating goals.

Once the initial prototype operation is fully oeprational, it  is expected to be somewhat easier to fund expansion into a regional brand, and then national brand.

Risks & Challenges

The number one challenge is getting the brand known.  Our initial campaign envisions a massive marketing effort disproportionate to the expected sales.  This will consist of massive internet search engine advertising and regional direct mail advertisements.  While the costs will initially be high, the expected increased in customer flow will establish proof of concept.  As units are added, the marketing cost per customer will drop dramatically while profits will climb rapidly.

It is expected that meeting expanding production from increased sales in a timely manner with proper quality standards may strain the initial phase of operations.  A limited test of the marketing concepts in our current small scale operation overwhelmed our staff and facilities and the marketing had to be reduced to maintain quality standards and timely deliveries.

Other Ways You Can Help

Please help by using the Indiegogo share tools to spread the word to artists, homeowners, galleries, memorabilia collectors,  museum professionals and anyone who has needs in this area.
story_txt:
The principles of Best Frame Shops have a combined 50 years of experience in dealing with fine and rare art as well as museum caliber custom framing.The principle acquired a small San Diego art and framing operation in 2013 after operating one of the largest galleries in a large eastern city for many years. 
The chief technician is a meticulous craftsman with 20 years of experience in a vast array of fabrication skills that many sales persons in the big box stores have never heard of.
While his skills can't cover all the anticipated fabrication needs of the company, his ability to train others and set quality standards is essential to growing this business.
The art operations of the gallery continues as dealing in rare and fine art can be done in the age of the internet almost anywhere. However the framing operation evolved in an entirely unexpected manner.  
Most of the retail framing customers that we met were looking for an alternative to the big box national brands. They wanted a more personalized, professional service, faster turnaround than could be found in remotely serviced "stores" along with reasonable prices and quality workmanship all of  which they found seriously lacking at the big box stores.
Perhaps more surprising, the best employees of the big box stores came by looking for employment.  Many of these employees had artistic backgrounds, which is a particularly fragile vocation, and were all too easily manipulated by the Wall St. run firms to accept anything in their field meaning low wages, part time benefit free work and impossible scheduling. 
Kicking this around we realized that this corporate model was all too often seen in America in recent years. Big investment funds, usually handling money for wealthy individuals would set up well funded businesses which outsourced their suppliers to get very low prices and then hire low paid domestic employees to sell them.  The profits were often kept offshore and the owners were paid in low or no tax dollars using various offshore and other tax avoidance strategies which the Wall St. investment banks specialize in.  The Wall Street off shore model dominates most brands and it is no accident that they have a competitive advantage as they keep most of their costs at bare minimums to maximize profits.And this model was seen in the picture framing industry as practiced in the big box stores as well. 
 It seemed to us that another model could be developed where employees could earn middle class wages with basic 21st century benefits like health insurance and earned leave if the profits were not siphoned off by various financial strategies engineered by Wall St. financiers. Shareholders would benefit as well if corporate earnings were sent directly to the stockholders instead of passing through the sticky hands of Wall Street.  And, it seems to us,  an unusual confluence of circumstances exists in this industry that makes it possible for these benefits to be realized with the the Best Frame Shops model as there is little comparable competition in this market
 
First, efficiencies made possible by technological advances means more productive employees who can then be paid more. Well paid employees are loyal employees with an interest in producing a mistake free product, always the achilles heel of custom made goods.  With demographic shifts favoring home ownership spending over the next 40 years there is a substantial and growing market to be tapped. And today where there is only a declining number of independents and and increasing number of omnibus big box retailers there is a unique opportunity to establish a preeminent specialized brand with all the competitive advantages that entails.
 Second, computer assisted design and fabrication means reduced training requirements.  Instead of learning demanding hand-to-eye related skills in cutting and fitting materials to exacting tolerances, the machine can do it first time, every time  to exacting measurements.   A key strategy of the company is to integrate and localize production so that every sales outlet can also produce a high quality final custom product and that requires trained employees with the necessary skills to get jobs done quickly and error free.   Computer assisted craftsmanship means employees can be trained and plugged in quickly and profitably wherever needed.  
Third, multiple professionally staffed locations drive marketing costs down per sales dollar. In today's world there is nothing that is more critical to brand establishment than saturation marketing.  Saturation marketing becomes cost effective when the cost is divided up among multiple units. Conversely the more you market, the more you are likely to be judged by ubiquitous consumer reviews which are increasingly the basis of consumer purchasing decisions.  Brands with quality control problems can't thrive. Our quality control experience has yielded a steady stream of very favorable reviews.  And key to quality control is computer assisted production, monitoring and control strategies. 
Our current operating situation is not conducive to growth and expansion.  However the basic premise of our business plan is born out by test advertising campaigns that have generated more demand than we can handle.  So our first objective is to move into a more suitable physical space closer to our target demographic base and set up the brand prototype unit.
Our budget is roughly broken down into 4 basic components.
     $25,000 for facility acquisition and leasehold improvements.
     $37,500  for Inventory expansion and product diversification.
         $37,500 for new equipment including custom engineered robotic machines.
       $37,500 for intensive marketing in the first year to establish proof of concept and the basis for further expansion.
Our primary priority is to open an appropriate facility to allow us to operate at the scale we need to achieve maximum traction in the industry. In the event we do not receive our full funding in the initial campaign, we will use available funding to set up the physical prototype operation and then revisit funding services to obtain the needed funds to achieve our prototype operating goals.
Once the initial prototype operation is fully oeprational, it  is expected to be somewhat easier to fund expansion into a regional brand, and then national brand.
Risks & Challenges

The number one challenge is getting the brand known.  Our initial campaign envisions a massive marketing effort disproportionate to the expected sales.  This will consist of massive internet search engine advertising and regional direct mail advertisements.  While the costs will initially be high, the expected increased in customer flow will establish proof of concept.  As units are added, the marketing cost per customer will drop dramatically while profits will climb rapidly.
It is expected that meeting expanding production from increased sales in a timely manner with proper quality standards may strain the initial phase of operations.  A limited test of the marketing concepts in our current small scale operation overwhelmed our staff and facilities and the marketing had to be reduced to maintain quality standards and timely deliveries.

Other Ways You Can Help
Please help by using the Indiegogo share tools to spread the word to artists, homeowners, galleries, memorabilia collectors,  museum professionals and anyone who has needs in this area.

story:
New Orleans’ Iconic Musicians Struggle to Rebuild their Lives in the Wake of Hurricane Katrina as they Strive to Keep the Music Alive in the Birthplace of Jazz

The film stars stellar musicians including Dr John, The Hot 8 Brass Band, Irma Thomas, The Preservation Hall Brass Band, Donald Harrison, The Treme Brass Band, The TBC Brass Band, Ellis and Delfeao Marsalis and Charmaine, Damion, Cyril, Jason and Gaynielle Neville families, Walter Payton Jr, Wardell and Brian Quezergue, Al 'Carnival Time' Johnson - full cast below.

The documentary captures the moment in the history of New Orleans' music, after the music stopped. It features the musicians' phenomenal lifeline, a charity, The New Orleans Musicians' Clinic, which gives them access to free medical care. The film features nearly 50 music tracks, from several genres of music, and many more musicians. As the celebrated musician Dr John says in the film, “If the musicians ain’t got a chance to live, then what chance has the music got?” 

The issues raised in the film are unresolved.

Now finished the film can entertain and inform music lovers internationally. It was screened with great success at festivals in the USA and UK,

"Thank you for making this film. It had a profound effect on my husband and me... Hopefully that feeling spreads like wildfire as the film reaches ever-larger audiences." Jackie D'Inzillo

This film shines a light on the musicians in the film, and the non-profit organisations, including The New Orleans Musicians' Clinic and WWOZ Radio, which took part.

This film exists because of the determination and kindest of many, and a solid generous core team.  It was finished this September 2016. This was achieved over time.

MORE ABOUT THE FILM

 “One Note at a Time” pays homage to the musicians who courageously return to New Orleans in the aftermath of the catastrophic flooding of Hurricane Katrina in 2005. They return specifically to resuscitate the music scene and save the legacy of rich musical heritage in their hometown. This is their story, told in their own words. It is also the story of the New Orleans Musicians’ Clinic, evolving into the New Orleans Musicians’ Assistance Foundation, whose mission continues to keep New Orleans’ culture ALIVE by providing health case, social services and wellness outreach programs to overcome New Orleans’ dire health disparity. 

Filmed over the course of four years ,“One Note At a Time” includes interviews with Grammy awards winner Dr. John; Irma Thomas, the ‘Soul Queen of New Orleans; jazz trumpeter Kermit Ruffins; Ben Jaffe of Preservation Hall; and British born Trad Jazz drummer, Barry Martyn. Some of the final interviews and performances, by Crescent City icons, include bassist Walter Payton, Jr.; composer, arranger and bandleader Wardell Quezergue, considered the ‘Creole Beethoven’; Herman “Roscoe” Ernest III, Dr. John’s drummer; as well as jazz and blues musician and vocalist ‘Uncle’ Lionel Batiste. Musicians’ Clinic interviews include Director and President Bethany Ewald Bultman, Co-founding Director E.Johann Bultman, and Family Nurse Practitioner Catherine Lesperches takes part.   

Comments director Renee Edwards, “One Note at a Time” is the story of both the health of the musicians and of the music industry after the devastation of Hurricane Katrina and it’s told through the prism of the New Orleans Musicians’ Clinic.” 

 Musical highlights include performances by Dr. John, The Preservation Hall Jazz Band, Damien Neville, Charmaine Neville, Ellis Marsalis and the New Orleans Ragtime Orchestra, among others. Classic songs include “Purple Rose of Cairo,” “Summertime,” “Umbrella,” “Papa Was a Rolling Stone,” “Down By the Riverside,” “This Little Light of Mine,” “Hit the Road Jack,” “Sister Kate,” “Carnival Time” and “You’re Nobody Til Somebody Loves You.” 

Edwards continues, “As a child growing up I often visited my dad who lives in New Orleans. My mother is British and I was raised in England. As a filmmaker I am naturally curious, so I wanted to make a documentary about what was happening to the culture and music post the hurricane and flooding. I also wanted to see how it was going to compare to my memories. We witnessed a transformation; sometimes it felt like the music was slipping away, and then it would surge up again.” 

 “One Note at a Time” marks the directorial debut for editor, producer and writer Renee Edwards. Some of her better known British television credits include the long running investigative news and current affairs series’ “Panorama,” “Unreported World” and “Dispatches.” Acclaimed documentary include “A Fight to the Death” and “The Mind Reader.” Film credits include the animated feature “Balto,” voiced by Kevin Bacon, Bob Hoskins, Bridgette Fonda and Phil Collins, and the shorts, award winning “In Recovery” and “Fauna Sauna.”

 

ABOUT THE PRODUCTION

“One Note at a Time” was filmed over four years. It pays homage to the musicians who courageously returned to their hometown of New Orleans after the devastation of Hurricane Katrina. Compelled to come back and determined to resuscitate the music scene, this is their story, told in their own words. It is also the story of the New Orleans Musicians’ Clinic that evolved into the New Orleans Musicians’ Assistance Fund, whose mission is to keep New Orleans’ culture ALIVE by providing social services and outreach.

 

CAST BIOS

Ben Jaffe is the creative director for both Preservation Hall and the Preservation Hall Jazz Band. He is the son of co-founders Allan and Sandra Jaffe and took over the directorships upon returning from Oberlin College in Ohio. An accomplished musician, he plays tuba and upright bass in the band. Some of his accomplishments include spearheading the New Orleans Musicians Hurricane Relief Fund.

Bethany Ewald Bultman is the co-founder and president and director of The New Orleans Musicians' Clinic that was established in 1998. The Assistance Foundation emerged after Hurricane Katrina in 2005 to expand the clinic's mission to keep New Orleans culture ALIVE by providing social services and outreach programs. The programs at NOMC&AF are primarily donor driven and stress prevention, advocacy, and economic empowerment.

Dr. John is an iconic American singer, songwriter, pianist and guitar player. His music combines blues, pop and jazz, as well as zydeco, boogie woogie and rock and roll. A multiple Grammy award winner and Rock and Roll Hall of Fame recipient he is perhaps best known for his Top 20 hit, “Right Place Wrong Time.”


Wardell Quezergue was an American music arranger, producer and bandleader. He was referred to as the “Creole Beethoven.” During filming he was working on a contemporary classical piece entitled “The Passion of Christ.”


Walter Payton, Jr. played jazz bass and sousaphone with the Preservation Hall Jazz Band, the French Market Jazz Hall Band and the Young Tuxedo Brass Band. He also led the Snap Bean Band, which was his own group. Some of the luminaries that he worked with are Aaron Neville, Harry Connick, Jr. and Jack Dupree. Sadly he passed away in 2010.


Al 'Carnival Time' Johnson is a rhythm and blues singer and piano player. He is a Mardi Gras icon for writing the Mardi Gras song, “Carnival Time.” A veteran at the New Orleans Jazz and Heritage Festival his work has been featured in Academy Award nominated films and he is a Louisiana Hall of Fame inductee.

The “Soul Queen of New Orleans,” Irma Thomas, is an American singer. She received a Grammy Award in the Best Contemporary Blues Album category for “After the Rain,” in 2007. It was her first Grammy in a career that has spanned over fifty years.

Shelton 'Shakespear' Alexander is professionally known as the “African American Shakespeare” or simply "Shake." He has been on the spoken word scene since August 2001, when he debuted his first poem entitled, "Patience." As a spoken word artist, poet, writer, author and motivational speaker, he thrives on inspiring people with his soul filled words.

 

CREW BIOS

Director, editor, producer and writer Renee Edwards began her career in the entertainment industry in the mid 1990’s. Some of her better known British television credits include the long running investigative news and current affairs series’ “Panorama,” “Unreported World” and “Dispatches.” Award winning documentary dramas are “A Fight to the Death” and “The Mind Reader.” Film credits include the animated feature “Balto,” voiced by Kevin Bacon, Bob Hoskins, Bridgette Fonda and Phil Collins, and the shorts “In Recovery” and “Fauna Sauna.” “One Note at a Time” marks her directorial debut as a feature length documentarian.

Executive Producer, Paul Woolwich is a Emmy, Bafta and multiple Royal Television Society award winner well known for his extensive work at the BBC, ITV and Channel 4 in the UK His recent television movie documentaries include ‘Britain’s Secret Terror Force’, ‘Saving Africa’s Witch Children’ and ‘Proud and Prejudiced.' Documentary television series include numerous episodes of 'This Week,' Panorama’ and ‘Dispatches’ and his television drama credits are ‘Second Sight' (starring Clive Owen), ‘One Night in Bhopal’ and ‘Dirty War’, among others. He is currently the head of the AV Studio at Amnesty International's International Secretariat, responsible for global content.

Executive Producer, Craig McCall’s first cinema release as a director & producer was the critically acclaimed documentary ‘CAMERAMAN: The Life & Work of Jack Cardiff’; It premièred at Cannes, and has subsequently been screened at over 50 film festivals and sold worldwide. As an Executive Producer he recently completed four new feature documentaries.

Executive Producer, Sara Giles, is known for executive and associate producing many films including David Cronenberg’s ‘Spider’, starring Ralph Fiennes; Nick Cave and John Hillcoat’s film, The Proposition; and more recently the feature documentary ‘The Last Man on the Moon’ about Apollo astronaut Gene Cernan’s deeply personal story of fulfilment, love and loss.

Composer Ray Russell is an English session musician and guitar player. His television compositions include soundtracks for “A Touch of Frost,” “Bergerac,” “Plain Jane” and “Inspector Alleyn Mysteries, as well as many other British and American shows.

 

DIRECTOR’S STATEMENT

One Note at a Time, set in New Orleans, has been nine years in the making. Four of these were spent following a small number of musicians from different genres, as they came to terms with their changed city, musical landscape and life. Intertwined are their musical and health stories, as they frequent the New Orleans Musicians’ Clinic, a lifeline and comfort, that simultaneously had its own struggles, whilst aspiring to fulfil a mission to ‘keep the music ALIVE’.

I felt compelled to make this film having visited the city throughout my life to see my family. I’m British born to an English mother and African American father. School summer holidays were regularly spent in New Orleans. As an adult I came to know the city in a new way, and very much appreciated the live sound of the music which beat through my childhood in England and America. I think the storm and subsequent destruction made me sad for my own loss, as well as the people who suffered directly. I had only started to get to know the city on my own terms for the few years before Katrina hit.

Through the film we were able to capture a special moment in music history, even though the issues raised in the film are ongoing. One unusual aspect to the film is that a number of the musicians have sadly passed away since we started filming, and so the film includes some of their last performances and interviews, and honours them; these musicians include Wardell Quezergue, Uncle Lionel Batiste, Walter Payton Jr, Herman ‘Roscoe’ Ernest and Clarence ’Trixzey’ Slaughter.

I believe as a black, female film maker, who led a team of American and English crew, and almost all American cast, that I was able to tell this story in a unique way, because of my own heritage and history.

Bethany Ewald Bultman, co-founding director of the New Orleans Musicians’ Clinic, featured in the documentary, wrote me recently after viewing the film, "The powerful question of your film is IF New Orleans’ music will survive? You artfully depict the factors from without and within which are undermining its health and survival. No other film has ever accomplished this.’

I’m very happy we have achieved this, and hope the audience enjoys it, and finds it a valuable record and salute to all the musicians of New Orleans and their supporters.

CAST CREDITS
In Order of Appearance 

Bicycle Ballad Sam, ‘Uncle’ Lionel Batiste, Barry Martyn, Ralph Gavin, Herman 'Roscoe' Ernest III, Nathaniel Franklin, Wardell Quezergue, Mac ‘Dr. John’ Rebenack, David Fountain, George Ingmire, Walter Payton Jr., Johann Bultman, Bethany Bultman, Washboard Chaz Trio, Kermit Ruffins, Paul Pattan and the Barracudas, Catherine Lasperches, Keng Harvey, Tonya and Left Field, Ragtime Orchestra - Lars Edegran-Leader, Ronell Johnson-Trombone, Jason Marsalis- Drums, Matt Rhody-Violin, Wendell Brunious-Trumpet, Otis Bazoon-Clarinet, Preservation Hall Band, Ben Jaffe, Damien Neville, Charmaine Neville, Detroit Brooks, Jesse Boyd, Keng Harvey, Al 'Carnival Time ' Johnson, Ellis Marsalis, Darrian Douglas, Rose Mancini, Louise Griffin, Brian Quezergue, Irma Thomas, Felice Guimont, Bud Tower, Ben Jaffe, Ellis Marsalis, Dr. Fontenot, Shelton ‘Shakespear’ Alexander, Jennifer Jones, Shannon Powell, Pinstrip Brass Band, Eric L. Cager, ‘Uncle Lionel Batiste’, Rose Mancini, Treme Brass Band, Nina Buck, Barry Price, George Ingmire, Amy Cano, Jesse Moore, Chip Wilson, Honky Tonkin’ Donkey, Erin Zeno, Sr., Roy Lancaster, Young Fellaz Brass Band, Mike Corrigan, Hot 8 Brass Band, Bennie Pete, Terrell ‘Burger’ Batiste, Jerry Embree Band, Edward ‘Juicy’ Jackson, TBC Brass Band, Tamara Jackson, Clarke Peters, Billy Delle, Donald Harrison Jr., Amasi Miller, Gaynielle Neville, Shannon Powell, Cyril Neville, Jesse Boyd, Detroit Brooks, Cliff Hines, Sascha Masakowski, Rex Gregory, Delfeao Marsalis, Ms. Pearl, Brian Quezergue, Gypsy Elise and the Royal Blues, Million Dollar Baby Dolls, Baby Boyz Brass Band, Washboard Jazz Trio, Preservation Hall Jazz Band, John Foho, Darrian Douglas, Kenneth Terry, Cliff Hines Quintet, Maison Bourbon House Band, Uptown Jazz Orchestra, Roger Lewis, Roland Guerin, Jack Miele, Doug Belote, Shane Theriot, Eric. F. Honsby, Emile Hall, Harry Sterling, Van Odom, Francis Olinsky, Dewey T. Ampson, Joe Dyson, Max Morah, Graham Robinson, David Fly, Cathi Fontenot MD, Benny Jones, Julius McKee.

story:
Up-cycling product recupkit

The New Trend in Ethical Designing, A compound word made up of Up-grade and Re-cycling, Up-cycling is a process of upgrading recycled wastes and recreating them into a whole new product

 

 

CONFIGURATION & BENEFIT

The recupkit  is an up-cycling product developed by MondoMio Co., Ltd., an industrial design specialist company.

 

 

ASSEMBLY

The recupkit is protected by intellectual property rights through utility model, trademark and design registration.

 

 

DEVELOPMENT PROCESS

The recupkit is an up-cycling product using a discarded take-out cup.

 

 

PRODUCTION STAGE

The final product is manufactured considering the strength of the part of the hook, the bar(hook ring) to enlarge the width between the join-sticks, and the sectional structure with multiple thicknesses

 

 

RECUPKIT IN THE NEWS

Launched the brand of recupkit and release of the product in March, 2016

 

 

THE TEAM BEHIND RECUPKIT

 

 

REWARDS

“Please select which organizations you will donate through this campaign!”
With your feedback, 1% of the amount you funded will be donated to an international environmental organization.

“What will be your choice?”

-Where to buy recupkit?
Please buy one of the perks. Listed on the right. Currently we do not offer any alternative way of purchasing. If you want to purchase more than 10,000pcs, please contact to sales@recupkit.com

-Where are we now and why Indiegogo?
We have been working on this project for the past two years and needless to say we're super excited to be finally in the position to let the world know about it.
We've invested heavily in this product - time, resources and money towards tooling - we now need your help so we can begin manufacturing at scale!

- Is the product helpful for the global environment?
Yes, it is. A huge number of disposable cups are being thrown away as garbage. Global coffee franchises’ disposable take-out cups made specifically for their promotions are easily discarded. Even though it is very beautiful in design, but it is easily discarded because of disposable.
Through this campaign, you can reuse the recycling cup, and 1% of the amount you will support will be donated to the international environmental organization of your choice. We have two opportunities to protect the global environment.

-Experience you can trust
These last few years of experience in design, manufacturing, global logistics and fulfilling orders have been truly invaluable and we believe we are in a great position to make sure that this project is as smooth as possible. We have a fantastic and trusted relationship with each member of the chain- meaning that we are confident that we can deliver recupkits to you before Earth Day on April 22nd.

-Other ways you can help
If you're not ready for recupkit just yet you still can help the campaign by letting your friends know. Or even better- just think of that one friend who you think might just LOVE recupkit and send them a link to this.

Lets be friends, follow us!

Facebook / Instagram / Pinterest / Twitter

 

 

MONDOMIO STORY

My world - MondoMio,

In the sense that the consumer creates a flushed smile when they touch MondoMio, MondoMio aims to provide customers with impressive Items, fun and full of spared values in the lifestyle, and the pleasure of finding a happy way of life.

story:
our mission is to deliver smart and affordable oral hygiene to everyone.

Brushette® is a patented snapping system that allows you to replace only the dirty bristles of your Oral-B® Braun toothbrush. Replacement bristles are now 10x cheaper, arrive individually wrapped in sterile packaging, more eco-friendly and delivered to your front door every month!

  

 

compatible with your current electric toothbrush

Our neck adapter is compatible with all Oral-B® Braun electric toothbrush models (except the Pulsonic). The neck is a device that will give you access to a lot more functions.  Simply attach the neck adapter to your current electric toothbrush, swap to the desired function and away you go!

 

 

discover all of Brushettes' benefits

If you are using an electric toothbrush you’ll  know how incredibly expensive the replacement heads are. This can prevent consumers from replacing them far less often than they should. Brushette® solves this price tag issue and also addresses many other problems to bring you a brilliant brushing experience- every time.

  

  

     

   

brushette subscription plans

You've never had an oral hygiene plan quite like this! Brushette® is like having your own personal hygienist right in your own bathroom. You can customize how often you want them shipped, decide if you want to pay monthly or annually and decide what functions you want every time. We let you cancel hassle free anytime too!

   

 

Don't have an electric toothbrush yet?

Brushette® partnered with the leading brand Prodental™ who offers a compatible power toothbrush that allows everyone to try out the brushette experience. Purchase available at the end of the campaign with 3 color options. 
   

  

Why a wide range?

Think about it, the bristles are the part of your toothbrush head that’s up close and personal with your mouth and teeth. Even if you have a $250 super sleek electric toothbrush with 7 modes, Bluetooth capabilities and an app playing Spotify while you brush it won't function any better. Our focus is on functionality. Night time brushing may require more intensive plaque removal compared to morning's gentle brushing, so we developed a wide range of bristles to cater to all your needs, at any time of day!

  

    

Brushette® is a lifestyle you take with you

Our unique packaging makes travel a breeze! Each brushette is individually sealed in food-grade sterilized packaging guaranteeing maximum hygiene. Have you ever started packing for a trip, only to realize you need to store your toothbrush somewhere and simply cannot find a clean place to leave it? Among the piles of dirty socks, and old zipper bags, or just wrapped in toilet paper you may leave those bristles for several hours of flight time and baggage claim, yuck! With our sterilized food grade nitrogen packets, your brushettes will stay fresh and hygienic regardless of the distance you travel and places you go. So let's take a trip somewhere awesome, safe in the knowledge your toothbrush has never been this clean!

  

   

  

  

how do we manage quality?

To start with we use the same quality bristles as the leading brands! We also invest heavily in human and robotic controls throughout the entire manufacturing process of your brushettes. First the PE, POM, and filaments raw materials get a one-time SGS laboratory inspection. During the assembly lines we have quality control checkpoints at each stage until we reach the finished product. With QC/QA from TÜV laboratories we report every step of the process to comply with ISO 9001:2015 (latest) norms. The quality of the products you put in your mouth is our top priority. As with every product in the world, sometimes during manufacturing defects can arise. We strive for perfection but if for any reason you remain unhappy with your order we offer full customer support to resolve this.

   

 

  

We gained some of our experience working at Prodental™ manufacturing and selling toothbrushes for years. On top of that we gathered a team of dental professionals for designing our bristles and bringing the best products to your doorstep. 

 

  

 

 

Brushette® was awarded at the most prestigious inventors' contest: Concours Lépine International de Paris 2018.

   

 

As seen on connected TV channels like:

 

 

Product Reviews

Mike Stephen - early adopter
"I really enjoyed the brushettes since day one. I was given a pack of 20 and it's just so much better to swap functions periodically. I feel free and cleaner."

Dr Arielle Van Krey - dentist
"From the basic functions to the specific ones everything has been thought of. Glad Brushette® figured everyone's hygiene needs a different treatment."

Stephanie Bloomstein - Apaga Technology
"We were handed a full set of toothbrush, sterilizers and bristles. Well as Head of HR the personnel perceive this as a great perk. Highly recommended to the corporate world." 

Patrick Lorey - early adopter
"I've been using brushette for 3 months and it's particularly convenient for travelling. Toss in a few packets in your vanity case, they don't break and become very handy between 2 planes."

  

Some cool links

 

Brushette Inc. offices

We proudly work alongside other creators in a Wework office space in the beautiful neighborhood of Toluca Lake in Los Angeles, CA. All our product designs and innovations start right here!

3900 W Alameda Ave. Ste 1200 Burbank, CA 91505
  

 

Thank you!

Brushette® is a team effort and we can't give enough thanks to everyone involved for their support. We’ve had many MANY friends and acquaintance helping and supporting us for the past 2 years, too many for us to list on this page but we want to say a huge thank you to everyone from the bottom of our heart!

Toss in a few packets in your vanity case, they don't break and become very handy between 2 planes."
  

Some cool links






 
Brushette Inc. offices
We proudly work alongside other creators in a Wework office space in the beautiful neighborhood of Toluca Lake in Los Angeles, CA. All our product designs and innovations start right here!
3900 W Alameda Ave. Ste 1200 Burbank, CA 91505  

 

Thank you!

Brushette® is a team effort and we can't give enough thanks to everyone involved for their support. We’ve had many MANY friends and acquaintance helping and supporting us for the past 2 years, too many for us to list on this page but we want to say a huge thank you to everyone from the bottom of our heart!

story:
As our children grow from infant to toddlers, we've accumulated a mountain of toys and other stuff along the way. My wife and I looked for toys that the kids can use in their development and growth phases while minimizing the overall stuff in the process. When we couldn't find what we wanted in the market, we decided to fill the need ourselves.

KDL Blocks are life-sized soft blocks that can connect to make imaginative and functional pieces. Through imaginative play, the blocks aid in the child's creativity, self-expression, motor skills, and social skills. The blocks are designed to help children get moving through physical activities as well as letting them play with their imagination. And after the play is done, the blocks can be made to decorations and furniture that fits the child's play area.

                             

While combining and connecting KDL Blocks can be fun on it's own, flexing one's creative muscles is a joy! With our variety of pieces and shapes, children can use their imagination to their full extent to make anything!    

Sturdiness is key in any children's toy and our KDL Blocks are proof of that. Our blocks promote physical activity through play and can handle all the rough and tumble play toddlers, pre-schoolers, and older children are known for.

To promote physical activities, the blocks are designed to be easily handled by children in connecting them together and having fun. Activities such as balancing, crawling, lifting, rocking, jumping, rolling, riding, and climbing can be greatly enhanced by our KDL Blocks.

After a long day of play, clutter is usually what meets all parents. Tidying and cleaning up can also be a challenging part. The beauty of our KDL Blocks is that they  can be put away easily by forming them in the decor and furniture you need. Chairs, stools, tables, and other furniture can be constructed so they can be put aside or to relax on.

We are two young families with expertise in the business, finance, and engineering fields wanting to start something to benefit our children as they grow. With our combined experiences and wanting to make a long-lasting impact, we started Kidz Discovery Land a.k.a KDL in 2016.

With the realization that toys are the gateway to all types of play and child development, our goal is to use our creative and technical abilities to bring to life innovative toys for all children and child at heart!

  

General inquiry | info@kdltoy.com

Retail/Distribution | contact@kdltoy.com

Want to work with us? Please contact us | info@kdltoy.com

How do the KDL Blocks connect together?

The blocks connect using connectors, rods, and other small pieces to place in the holes of the bigger blocks. 

 

What colors does the KDL Blocks come in?

Our KDL Blocks are based on 14 colors carefully chosen to promote children's brain development.

What are the KDL Blocks made of?

Our blocks are made 100% with firm EVA Foam. And with the high end machine and special tech the blocks are made to last life time. They are BPA-FREE and Phthalate-FREE and meet the requirements for children's toys in the US.

What age group is this suited for?

KDL Blocks are most beneficial from late infancy (6-8 months) to school age children (6-11 years old). For infants, the colorful blocks will catch their eye and will be safe to touch and push around with. As they reach the toddler stage, their creativity and playfulness will shine through playing with the blocks, setting the stage for endless peek-a-boos, climbing, and stacking. As the children get older the blocks can serve as great play set pieces that can stimulate their motor skills and imaginative prowess, either during individual play or with friends.

How safe are these to play on?

The blocks are made of soft but tough material that won't collapse when stood on, jumped on, or when connecting together. There are no abrasive corners to scratch and the sides are soft to touch.

story:
Weighted Blankets for Kids & Teens

Ballast Blankets are premium weighted blankets

Our weighted blankets are designed for children and teens.  

They use sensory stimulation to gently apply deep touch pressure across the pressure points of your child's body.

Ballast Blankets help relax the nervous system by simulating the sensation of being hugged or embraced.

The sensory input of the blanket increases serotonin and melatonin levels and decreases cortisol levels; promoting restful sleep

Go to sleep faster.  Stay asleep longer.

 

The underlying science behind weighted blankets is called Deep Touch Pressure.

Deep Touch Pressure (DTP) is a gentle pressure applied evenly over the body.  You see the benefits of DTP with hugs, massages and weighted blankets!

Though weighted blankets have been used in the medical community for many years, the measurable health benefits have only recently begun to emerge in scientific studies.

 

 

Deep Touch Pressure  is a well regarded therapeutic method that stimulates pressure points on the body linked to improved sleep, mood, and relaxation.

Each blanket is designed to represent approximately 10% of your child's body weight.

The blanket evenly distributes this weight across the pressure points of their body.

Each blanket is made up of a weighted duvet, with a removable cover made with soft, cuddly minky fleece chenille. 

This gentle pressure mimics the sensation of being hugged or embraced.

 

 

One side is smooth and the other dimpled to provide a different tactile sensation

 

The weight filling is odourless, non-toxic, food grade poly pellets.  The pellets are dense to add weight and soft to provide a nice texture.

 

 

Sleep is an important part of growing up and succeeding at school.

Sleep doesn't always come easy.  

Many children and teens have difficulties going to sleep and staying asleep.

Parents feel the stress and fatigue of this sleeplessness too.

The team members at Ballast Blankets are parents of children ranging in age from teenagers to toddlers.  

We know the importance of sleep for our children's development and well being.

We looked at a variety of sleep aids:  lighting, background music, room temperatures and sleep consultants.  And through this journey came across scientific research and studies about the benefits of Deep Touch Pressure and weighted blankets.

The studies demonstrated the positive effects of weighted blankets on serious conditions like autism, PTSD, and insomnia.

And there is increasing evidence that this type of sensory input can promote relaxation and deeper sleep for everyone.

We decided to create a weighted blanket to help children and teens reduce feelings of stress, lower feelings of anxiety, and promote deeper sleep.

We experimented with several designs and prototypes.  

We came up with a soft, luxurious blanket that is wonderful to touch, feels great and most importantly - IT JUST WORKS. 

Ballast Blankets is the result.  Dream with us!

 

How do I contact the campaign team?

info@ballastblankets.com  or (403) 980-1482

 

Are there shipping costs?

Shipping within Canada is provided free.

We ship to the USA and other countries.  A shipping fee will be added at checkout for shipping to addresses outside Canada.

 

Do weighted blankets help with anxiety?

Research shows that weighted blankets for children can help reduce anxiety naturally.

 

Do you have more than one colour?

Ballast Blankets are made from a minky fleece that is the colour Azurite. We carefully selected this calming and soothing colour.

We will be launching a collection of summer weight covers in our Spring Collection in early 2018.

 

In what currency are your prices?

The Perks are listed in Canadian dollars.

If you are outside Canada, the price will be converted to your home currency by your credit card company at the time your contribution is made. 

 

Refund Policy

Support Ballast Blankets with confidence!

If you don't love your Ballast Blanket, you are welcome to return it within thirty days for a full refund.
story_txt:
Weighted Blankets for Kids & TeensBallast Blankets are premium weighted blanketsOur weighted blankets are designed for children and teens.  They use sensory stimulation to gently apply deep touch pressure across the pressure points of your child's body.Ballast Blankets help relax the nervous system by simulating the sensation of being hugged or embraced.The sensory input of the blanket increases serotonin and melatonin levels and decreases cortisol levels; promoting restful sleepGo to sleep faster.  Stay asleep longer. The underlying science behind weighted blankets is called Deep Touch Pressure.Deep Touch Pressure (DTP) is a gentle pressure applied evenly over the body.  You see the benefits of DTP with hugs, massages and weighted blankets!Though weighted blankets have been used in the medical community for many years, the measurable health benefits have only recently begun to emerge in scientific studies.  Deep Touch Pressure  is a well regarded therapeutic method that stimulates pressure points on the body linked to improved sleep, mood, and relaxation.Each blanket is designed to represent approximately 10% of your child's body weight.The blanket evenly distributes this weight across the pressure points of their body.Each blanket is made up of a weighted duvet, with a removable cover made with soft, cuddly minky fleece chenille. This gentle pressure mimics the sensation of being hugged or embraced.
  One side is smooth and the other dimpled to provide a different tactile sensation The weight filling is odourless, non-toxic, food grade poly pellets.  The pellets are dense to add weight and soft to provide a nice texture.  Sleep is an important part of growing up and succeeding at school.Sleep doesn't always come easy.  Many children and teens have difficulties going to sleep and staying asleep.Parents feel the stress and fatigue of this sleeplessness too.The team members at Ballast Blankets are parents of children ranging in age from teenagers to toddlers.  We know the importance of sleep for our children's development and well being.We looked at a variety of sleep aids:  lighting, background music, room temperatures and sleep consultants.  And through this journey came across scientific research and studies about the benefits of Deep Touch Pressure and weighted blankets.The studies demonstrated the positive effects of weighted blankets on serious conditions like autism, PTSD, and insomnia.And there is increasing evidence that this type of sensory input can promote relaxation and deeper sleep for everyone.We decided to create a weighted blanket to help children and teens reduce feelings of stress, lower feelings of anxiety, and promote deeper sleep.We experimented with several designs and prototypes.  We came up with a soft, luxurious blanket that is wonderful to touch, feels great and most importantly - IT JUST WORKS. Ballast Blankets is the result.  Dream with us! How do I contact the campaign team?info@ballastblankets.com  or (403) 980-1482 Are there shipping costs?Shipping within Canada is provided free.We ship to the USA and other countries.  A shipping fee will be added at checkout for shipping to addresses outside Canada. Do weighted blankets help with anxiety?Research shows that weighted blankets for children can help reduce anxiety naturally. Do you have more than one colour?Ballast Blankets are made from a minky fleece that is the colour Azurite. We carefully selected this calming and soothing colour.We will be launching a collection of summer weight covers in our Spring Collection in early 2018. In what currency are your prices?The Perks are listed in Canadian dollars.If you are outside Canada, the price will be converted to your home currency by your credit card company at the time your contribution is made.  Refund PolicySupport Ballast Blankets with confidence!If you don't love your Ballast Blanket, you are welcome to return it within thirty days for a full refund.

story:
FOR MORE INFORMATION - GO TO OUR WEBSITE

http://www.spytrapprotect.com

 

  

How do we know that Alexa is LISTENING!

 

If you have the time and patience and want to learn more, click the link below: 

https://www.bloomberg.com/news/articles/2019-07-19/you-re-home-alone-with-alexa-are-your-secrets-safe-quicktake

...your answer is SPYTRAP Privacy Protection!!

 

FOR MORE INFORMATION - GO TO OUR WEBSITE

http://www.spytrapprotect.com

 

 

Our SPYTRAP Devices and How They Work

Privacy

SPYTRAP is completely self contained and isolated from the internet.  SPYTRAP blocks conversations not directed to Alexa from leaving your home, dorm or office.

Easy to Use

SPYTRAP maintains Alexa's Echo/Dot's full capability and ease of use by allowing you to remotely and securely activate the mute/unmute feature.

Simple to Set Up

SPYTRAP uses a connecting strip to plug into the Echo/Dot power port.  SPYTRAP provides alignment features to ensure proper installation on your Alexa device.

Compatibility

SPYTRAP is compatible with Amazon's Echo and Echo Dot devices.  It is installed on top of the device while continuing to provide you with the features and ease of use that you are familiar with.

 

How does SPYTRAP work?

 

 

Why SPYTRAP as a WAKE WORD? 

 

Why not simply press the mute button on my device?

 

But will my Alexa device work the same once I install SPYTRAP?

Yes!....

 

What if I don't mind pressing the mute button?

 

Watch as we demonstrate the features of our lower cost non-voice activated SPYTRAP-M!

 

ADVANTAGES of our SPYTRAP approach!

 

What are our PROJECT OBJECTIVES?

                    

 

Our current expectation is to complete the following MILESTONES:

 

Are there any RISKS or CHALLENGES?

story:
Crazy lamp

French lamp

Mignon lamp

 

 

 

 

  • The lamps are hand made in perfectly clear first class glass. 
  • 3D logo engraved in our 3D studio in The Netherlands.
  • Light is provided by exchangeble long life led (3W / 270 lumens / 3000°K warm white). 
  • Dimmable
  • Input 220 / 110 V, 50/60Hz;  output 12 V, 1 A
  • Led socket is 3D printed in our 3D printing farm in the Netherlands. 
  • The bulb socket is in high quality aluminium.

 

 

Visit our Website : https://cristalight.com

 

 
 

After a new European law prohibiting the traditional wire bulb in Europe was accepted, we were saddened by the idea that rapidly we will not see its shape in our homes anymore.

Of course, we are aware of climate changes and necessity to make more energy effective lighting. We know that the led light is the future, but, our question was: is it possible to save this shape anyhow? 

For the first lighting bulbs the desire was to reproduce it in its exact standard dimension. We wanted it classy and funny at the same time. And we think that we have succeeded, you'll never be bored with it!  

Today we are happy with the result. Our good old bulb will stay among us. We bring it back to life. The bulb is alive!

 

 

 

 

Actually, we produced 5 bulbs. Two of them are made in cooperation with Belgian crystal factory Val Saint Lambert that we work together for already 7 years.  

We have the designing projects for many more and they will be available on our website.

What’s the interest of so many different bulbs? Well, our lamps are designed in the way that you can easily change the bulb and change its look as you wish so it never becomes boring.

 

 

Symphony M

Symphony L
 

  • The lamps are hand made in high quality Val Saint Lambert crystal (made in Belgium). 
  • 2 sizes and 4 colors of the bulb are available (clear, red, blue and green) 
  • Original decoration sandblasted by Val Sain Lambert.
  • Light is provided by exchangeble long life led (3W / 270 lumens / 3000°K warm white). 
  • Dimmable
  • Input 220 / 110 V, 50/60Hz;  output 12 V, 1 A
  • Led socket is 3D printed in our 3D printing farm in the Netherlands. 
  • The bulb socket is in high quality aluminium.


Two of our lamps were exposed in their show room during the factory's Open Days.

 

We already produced the components for first 100 lamps. Actually, we are in the assembling phase and first lamps should be finished in the middle of February. The deliveries will start before the end of the campaign so that our contributeurs can receive their lamps very fast.

We will keep you informed in the updates and comments section when the first deliveries will start.

 

The biggest challenge was the lighting. The lamp is attractive and eye catching and as it's made in full transparent glass, we had issues with blinding. We also wanted the lighting source to be central and, finally, 3D printing technology helped us solving this problem. 

We have experimented a lot and made adjustments till we found the perfect solution. We enjoyed the 3D printing so much, that we decided to continue producing our led sockets by ourselves in our own 3D printing farm. 

Wire engraving was another issue. For 3D engraving you need a perfectly flat penetration zone for the laser beam. It's not possible with our curved bulbs. We had to develop our own engraving technique that allows us to not only use the rare flat zones for engraving, but also to get them in a good angle.   

 

Pressing the glass into the bulbs.

Laser engraving of the wire.

Led socket 3D printing.

 

 

 

 

 

As we already produced all the components for 120 first lamps, we will start the assembly production few days after the beginning of Indiegogo campaign. Like this we can begin deliveries in the second half of February.  

Our first goal is to satisfy our backers very fast.
