Help us build a community around ControllerX Smart Switch - in return we will be adding many accessories to the ControllerX platform - think waterproofing, wall mounts etc, larger sensor bays and many more.  

Best of all, if we hit our funding targets we'll be opening the accessories as 3D objects for download so you can start customising your projects sooner rather than later!

Safety

ControllerX will not ship until we have confirmed via an approved lab that we are compliant with the standards relevant to our switching device (US and Australian standards). Seeking regulatory approval in every country is not viable at this time.

Lastly, and most importantly, we need your orders! WHY?

We have our customised single shot (injection molded) double bay electrical housing that safely divides the high voltage bay vs where you house your Arduino. We need your combined orders to get the molds completed ready for full production - with your order help us build the ControllerX community!


FAQ

What input switched voltages are supported?

110V/240VAC Single Phase 50-60Hz

What input voltages are required to trigger the switch?

3.3V through 5Vdc.

Can I buy different length plugs, more plugs/leads and accessories?

We have put a lot of effort into creating a curated list of leads and accessories for ControllerX. These will come online once we complete our funding goal - purchase your ControllerX now, and we'll be emailing our community more details as the funding progresses. 

Also, where we can, we'll be offering free downloads of our accessories so you can print your own.

Shipping

Dates as indicated on the perks - we are pushing to complete the project on time or earlier, as always, there is some risk with every new product, but we believe we've taken the project far enough to eliminate many new product risks. Communication is key, and we'll try to bring you on the journey with us - for those that are interested in the smaller details around product design, assembly and distribution stay tuned!

What plugs do I need?

ControllerX comes with one input plug for powering up your ControllerX - it connects from your wall socket to the ControllerX IEC C13. When purchasing you select which style of plug you need for your location:  US/UK/Europe/Decide Later etc.

This is enough to get your Arduino powered up if you have purchased the ControllerX with the DC power supply.

To turn on/off an appliance with ControllerX you'll need an additional IEC C14 Male lead that has a female socket the other end that maps to your country/location. We have purposely left this out as your length of lead will differ greatly based on the projects you undertake.

Or, keep an eye out for stretch goals which will include an IEC to global female plug (meaning just plug in your device and go).

Does ControllerX come with an Arduino/RPi?

No, at this stage it's a BYO affair - however, keep an eye on the stretch goals - we'll be loading some tasty treats there!

What is in the low voltage bay, and how do I connect everything?

There is a terminal bay that allows you to connect to the DC power supply (if purchased), signal in to the relay to switch on/off, signal out from the current sensing.

You can use whatever technique you would like to connect your device - solder directly, add in a plug to make it easier.

Stretch Goals

We have a full list of stretch goals that will be published when funding exceeds $25,000.

About the founders

Matt & Dan are foremost best mates - both have studied computer science in the 90's and worked with technology ever since.

Dan has been focused on working on bleeding edge telecommunications technology across the globe. Dan is a fierce advocate of the democratisation of technology and working with ControllerX feels it's yet another way technology makes it easier for everyone to solve their problems without using expensive proprietary gear.

Matt has a long history working with corporations both in the US and Australia primarily focused on back office technology. ControllerX has it's history steeped with C programming with ERP systems that lent itself to Arduino programming.

The first two Arduino projects we tackled were turning a chest freezer into a beer fridge using an Arduino and a thermistor. Neither of us wanted to get into the higher voltage stuff. The next project was remotely turning on a pump to fill a tank when it was getting low (using a pressure sensor). Again, nothing easy, nothing safe!

ControllerX was born (and with your help and your order it'll come to life!).

Media
story_txt:
Want to do more with your Arduino or Raspberry Pi projects?All the benefits of traditional 'smart' switches, but with all the flexibility of your Arduino/RPi + your sensors.Control and measure 110V/240V without touching a single high voltage wire.Same problem every time, nothing easy, nothing safe!Unlike most smart switches ControllerX gives YOU the ability to bring the smarts - new Arduino/RPi, just swap out your old tech for new tech!ControllerX gives you the power to turn on or off your mains/line voltage power under whatever scenarios you can program an Arduino or RPi to do.What to control and monitorLights, fans, pumps, air conditioners, freezers/fridges, routers/modems, laundry equipment, pool equipment, security/safety around the office or home - basically any regular household electrical device or appliance!How to controlOnline, offline, wifi, bluetooth, LoRA, USB or anything you can imagine - bring your own device and shields where the possibilities are endless.Add your own sensors, think temperatures with thermistors (thermometers), sound activation (microphones), motion detection, distance monitoring, moisture sensing, air quality control.ControllerX has been designed for you to bring your own device.  Our low voltage bay gives you enough space to house an Arduino with up to 2 additional shields, Raspberry Pi with up to 2 additional shields or your own custom circuitry/MCU etc.Unlike other wifi enabled ‘smart’ switches we truly give you the capability to flick the switch, be it online or offline, with whatever logic you want.We bring the safety, you bring the smarts.We live in a dangerous high voltage appliance world - Many of the great devices around us are driven by electrical voltages that can do amazing things, however these higher voltages can also be deadly if handled poorly.The team behind ControllerX believes there are many of us that can create great solutions to common problems if only they had a switch that they could control/manipulate without having to touch dangerous wires.ControllerX solves this problem - giving young and old ‘makers/tinkerers’ alike the ability to fully control the power around them - be it online, offline or with smart/custom sensing built right into the design.FeaturesControllerX gives you a low voltage bay to house your Arduino, Raspberry Pi etcControllerX gives you a reliable DC power supply.ControllerX gives you full 15amp current sensing device available to be read by your device. Now you can monitor the current your appliances are using and intervene if necessary - maybe a pump is drawing too many amps (out of water/inlet covered etc), instantly cut the power and save your hardware.Controller X has an inbuilt I/O connectivity with a customisable backplate to mount your device securely and safely - while showing off your project through the see through window to the low voltage enclosure. International standardised IEC plugs save all of us the hassle of where you can use the device, as there are many off-the-shelf cord combinations to solve your more complex problems.FlexibilityYour ability to add your own micro controller (or other controller devices - RPi etc) and all your own sensors allows you to do remarkable things, with flexibility that you haven't seen before.For instance, we have successfully:Monitored our solar inverter. When excess power is available we turn on our pool pump. If there is still excess power we send a smart phone notification saying now is a good time to run the dishwasher or washing machine. If the pool pumps sucks air or exceeds a particular temperature the pump is turned off, the owner notified via push notification. Meanwhile logging all of your pool pump times allowing you to adjust if you're not happy with the end result - and giving you the added bonus that you can 'pause' the pool pump if you want to go for a peaceful swim. Add some speciality sensors and you can monitor pH, salinity and probably more things than we can think of! Add an exhaust fan to your roof, that only turns on when the internal roof temperature exceeds a threshold, or is greater than the outside ambient temperature and only in summer. The possibilities are endless, and although you can never remove all risks when working with electricity - we give you the safest way to control your world!Safety features
Overload protection
Surge protection
High/low voltage separation
No need to open high voltage bay
DC short circuit protection
If you can use a wall power point, then the ControllerX Smart Switch is good to go.Help us build a community around ControllerX Smart Switch - in return we will be adding many accessories to the ControllerX platform - think waterproofing, wall mounts etc, larger sensor bays and many more.  Best of all, if we hit our funding targets we'll be opening the accessories as 3D objects for download so you can start customising your projects sooner rather than later!SafetyControllerX will not ship until we have confirmed via an approved lab that we are compliant with the standards relevant to our switching device (US and Australian standards). Seeking regulatory approval in every country is not viable at this time.Lastly, and most importantly, we need your orders! WHY?We have our customised single shot (injection molded) double bay electrical housing that safely divides the high voltage bay vs where you house your Arduino. We need your combined orders to get the molds completed ready for full production - with your order help us build the ControllerX community!FAQWhat input switched voltages are supported?110V/240VAC Single Phase 50-60HzWhat input voltages are required to trigger the switch?3.3V through 5Vdc.Can I buy different length plugs, more plugs/leads and accessories?We have put a lot of effort into creating a curated list of leads and accessories for ControllerX. These will come online once we complete our funding goal - purchase your ControllerX now, and we'll be emailing our community more details as the funding progresses. Also, where we can, we'll be offering free downloads of our accessories so you can print your own.ShippingDates as indicated on the perks - we are pushing to complete the project on time or earlier, as always, there is some risk with every new product, but we believe we've taken the project far enough to eliminate many new product risks. Communication is key, and we'll try to bring you on the journey with us - for those that are interested in the smaller details around product design, assembly and distribution stay tuned!What plugs do I need?ControllerX comes with one input plug for powering up your ControllerX - it connects from your wall socket to the ControllerX IEC C13. When purchasing you select which style of plug you need for your location:  US/UK/Europe/Decide Later etc.This is enough to get your Arduino powered up if you have purchased the ControllerX with the DC power supply.To turn on/off an appliance with ControllerX you'll need an additional IEC C14 Male lead that has a female socket the other end that maps to your country/location. We have purposely left this out as your length of lead will differ greatly based on the projects you undertake.Or, keep an eye out for stretch goals which will include an IEC to global female plug (meaning just plug in your device and go).Does ControllerX come with an Arduino/RPi?No, at this stage it's a BYO affair - however, keep an eye on the stretch goals - we'll be loading some tasty treats there!What is in the low voltage bay, and how do I connect everything?There is a terminal bay that allows you to connect to the DC power supply (if purchased), signal in to the relay to switch on/off, signal out from the current sensing.You can use whatever technique you would like to connect your device - solder directly, add in a plug to make it easier.Stretch GoalsWe have a full list of stretch goals that will be published when funding exceeds $25,000.About the foundersMatt & Dan are foremost best mates - both have studied computer science in the 90's and worked with technology ever since.Dan has been focused on working on bleeding edge telecommunications technology across the globe. Dan is a fierce advocate of the democratisation of technology and working with ControllerX feels it's yet another way technology makes it easier for everyone to solve their problems without using expensive proprietary gear.Matt has a long history working with corporations both in the US and Australia primarily focused on back office technology. ControllerX has it's history steeped with C programming with ERP systems that lent itself to Arduino programming.The first two Arduino projects we tackled were turning a chest freezer into a beer fridge using an Arduino and a thermistor. Neither of us wanted to get into the higher voltage stuff. The next project was remotely turning on a pump to fill a tank when it was getting low (using a pressure sensor). Again, nothing easy, nothing safe!ControllerX was born (and with your help and your order it'll come to life!).Media

story:
EIOS is the first insulation in the world that offers a cladding and finishing system that completely eliminates the condensation phenomenon in the building envelope (the exterior walls of every building that separate the interior conditioned space from the exterior environment) by applying in practice a new concept of creating Vapor-Impermeable Insulation Systems, called Non-Permissive Insulations.

EIOS is made out of high-quality Extruded Polystyrene XPS with joints invented for double-sealing with polyurethane foam and an over-sealing with polymer material. The XPS is a vapor-impermeable insulation material. By vapor sealing all joints and intersections with other objects (windows, doors, etc.), we create a vapor-impermeable insulation assembly, the Non-Permissive Insulation.

Condensation is avoided when vapors are prevented from passing through an insulation assembly that has been applied to an enclosure that separates two environments with different temperatures.

The basic theory of this new concept is expressed by the newly discovered Principle of Avoiding Condensation.

 

From ancient times when people started building shelters until the present, construction has been done in the same way – with the idea of controlling unwanted factors such water, air, vapors, and thermal flow. This EIOS campaign will change this field though.

Contemporary construction has been relatively successful in controlling water, air, and thermal flow in the building envelope. However, the vapor control, dew point and condensation in the envelope walls have left builders in a precarious position. 

The current type of design and construction of envelope walls attempts to control moisture by reducing condensation and by creating the possibility for the walls to dry out. Some of the techniques used include leaving intentional airflow through the walls, utilizing drainage plans, and providing ventilation of the insulation.

While the Moisture Control concept is based on cycles of wetting and drying from season to season and makes use of vapor barriers, the Moisture Free concept is based on the complete elimination of the condensation phenomenon by creating Non-Permissive Insulations.

Those revolutionary inventions, the Principle of Avoiding Condensation and the Non-Permissive Insulation need your support and acceptance to be a current practice. 

 

 

The majority of people think that the actual design and realization of envelope walls is based on Avoiding the Condensation Phenomenon, but in reality it is based on Moisture Control and Managing Condensation by applying water/air/vapor barriers, creating drainage planes, and ventilation of walls.
The functioning of an envelope wall is based on cycles of wetting and drying, by accumulating humidity from condensation when the inside-outside temperature differences apply and by naturally drying the walls. The wetting of the envelope walls occurs when the inside of a structure is heated because of the outdoor colder temperatures.  It also happens when a building is cooled inside, and the outside environment is hot and humid. In cold or hot/humid climates, the heating and cooling of a building is virtually all four seasons, with only short periods of time when air/vapor driving forces are not applied to the wall. This cumulative, short period of time when condensation does not occur is just not enough time to dry the water accumulated, mainly due to the air/vapor barrier layers applied. The consequence is the occurrence of dampness, mold, and degradation such as wood rot and corrosion.

 

In regular continental climates, the quantity of condensation water accumulated in a cold season (90 days) is about 1 lbs/ft² (3-6 kg/m²) and dries in 80-160 days, meaning a cycle of water accumulation and drying.

In cold or hot climates, the quantity of water can easily double, the wetting period increases, the drying necessary time exceeds the period of the drying season, and moisture accumulates.

The consequence is well known: the beginning of interstitial (in the wall) mold grown, degradation of indoor air quality, fast decay of envelope walls, expensive repairs and lowering of property value.

 

While the entire world builds according to principles of Moisture Control, EIOS is our proposal to start building without moisture, based on the Principle of Avoiding Condensation.

 

Each of us lives in a house or building that must maintain a comfortable temperature and humidity level. Those conditions create differences of temperatures and relative humidity which in turn generates driving forces for energy flow and air/vapor movement. Temperature differences also generate dew point and condensation with the related consequences resulting in mold and degradation.
While the energy flow can be slowed down by adding real insulation value, the condensation phenomenon had no solution before the invention of the Principle of Avoiding Condensation.

A New Principle of Technology which enables the design of envelope walls without condensation.

One of the goals of this campaign is to share this new technical principle with the world. This allows builders to construct building enclosures that have completely eliminated the condensation phenomenon, the cycles of wetting and drying, mold, and degradation within envelope walls.

People involved in construction can attest to the fact that, when it comes to vapor transfer, condensation, mold, and consequences our actual prescriptive requirements for moisture control depend on the “vapor diffusion paradigm” and not on scientists’ default and reproducible experiments.                                            

The actual fundamental principle to control water in vapor form is to keep it out and to let it out if it happens to gets into the wall. Another common principle is to encourage drying mechanisms over wetting prevention mechanisms. This gets complicated because sometimes the best strategies to keep water vapor out actually end up trapping water vapor in, plus varying climates and seasons make this even more complicated. If using these principles, there needs to be different strategies for different climates. There also has to be consideration for the differences between summer and winter if following this principle, but this is rather impossible.

All these stipulations lead to legitimate question:

Is there a situation, configuration, or assembly that could avoid the condensation completely despite the climate or season? Can we have a general rule to use as a principle to avoid condensation in building enclosures and other such enclosures?

The answer is YES, and it makes the object of the new theory of Non-Permissive Insulation. The Principle of Avoiding Condensation can be formulated, understood, and used in designing and constructing enclosures. The value of this principle is obvious.

As a basic fundamental of science, the Principle of Avoiding Condensation is defined as:

When there is a temperature difference and an enclosure is interposed between the high interior temperature and the low exterior temperature (or vice versa), in order to avoid condensation, the heat flow needs to convert the cold flow in an insulation material or in a thermo-insulation assembly without vapor diffusion or any air/vapor flow that carries warm vapor towards cold areas.

After a deep understanding of the phenomenology and configuration of Vapor Impermeable Insulation or Non-Permeable Insulation Assemblies, the Principle of Avoiding Condensation can have a simple definition:

The condensation is avoided when the heat flow converts the cold flow in a Vapor Impermeable Insulation or a Non-Permissive Insulation Assembly.

Please download the pdf and share with your friends:

https://eios.co/principles-of-avoiding-condensa...

Be the first to read, understand, support, and implement this theory – it will change the thinking of how to construct walls and buildings.

So, the philosophy of this new Principle is that heat has to meet the cold in an insulation material or system without the presence of any vapors. By achieving this, the warm environment is "stopped" on the warm surface of the insulation, which is a condensation-free plane, because is in a dew-point free area.

  

By applying this theory in practice, the engineer Marius Radoane invented a Thermal Insulation and Finishing System which eliminates all problems of condensation, intruding or absorbed water, and in certain situations, the wall that receives this system dries to an unexpected humidity level, by simply applying a difference of temperature. This revolutionary design was first called “Non-Permissive Exterior Insulation and Finishing System (NP-EIFS)” and was invented as an integrated Concept, Technology, and Details to function in all real construction situations.

The actual promoters of wall systems teach us that a 30-40% humidity in the wood frame and drywall is normal. However these buildings have a short lifespan and lots of problems.

By applying the Principle of Avoiding Condensation materialized in the Design Technology to Eliminate Condensation we created EIOS (Exterior Insulation Over Specified). We bring to the world the first high insulated wall system that dries and stays dry in all environmental situations, providing an alternative to the breathing, wetting, and energy flow walls.

A new age of high-performance building envelope starts with the Principle of Avoiding Condensation, the theory of Non-Permissive Insulation, to which all can benefit.

More details on our campaign and proofs of how EIOS technology works please visit https://eios.co/

 

We are proud to introduce the first insulation and finish system that completely eliminates the condensation phenomenon on envelope walls. This is an integral solution to clad and insulate a building that guarantees permanently dry walls, no dampness, mold, fungi or degradation, as well as thermal efficiency Real R-value equal to the specified value of the insulation materials used.

EIOS high performance rendering is not possible without an integrated system between Concept, Technology, and Details that have been integrated to achieve the final goal.

The Zero Condensation Concept is the idea of eliminating the condensation phenomenon and intruding water. It also solves the problem of decreasing the specified thermal efficiency of insulation materials and/or partially applying the insulation value to envelope walls. All these things are only possible by applying the Principle of Avoiding Condensation and the theory of Non-Permissive Insulation.

Technology is created to achieve the Concept Goal. Regardless of how good a technology is, and what performance products uses, if the Concept does not stand up, the product results will fails.

A good cladding technology will also fail if the details of intersections with other constructive elements are deficient and not in accordance with the concept goal.

EIOS Technology provides insulation and triple sealing of every joint of insulation boards and intersection with other construction elements such as windows, doors, and other openings on the structure’s interior facing towards the exterior.

Detail Solutions are unique for each particular building.

These details form an integral part of EIOS technology to achieve the goal of avoiding condensation.

 

After six years of experimentation, applications, improvements, enlarging of scopes, observations, measurements of results, and patenting, we can give a close look at EIOS features:

 

All those benefits arise from the philosophy of avoiding condensation, and EIOS is the first one in the field to utilize this concept.

When contracting EIOS, you have all those benefits under one lifetime warranty.

 

EIOS System is the most advanced cladding, insulation and finishing system that you can have for your house or building investment, with a real distance from anything else you can find, relating functionality, durability and quality.

With the Zero Moisture feature for the thermal-envelope walls for an unlimited time, we give a Lifetime Warranty that your house will be dry and healthy. The Moisture Free warranty applies to any way in which the exterior environment can cause moisture by condensation, even including any form of intruding water.

EIOS System comes with an attractive stucco appearance and can accept any architectural design, color, and finishes.

 

A special price is available only with this campaign. It includes all material, scaffolding for low-rise constructions, exterior finishing, completion of the job, and EIOS Warranty.      

We consider it imperative to apply the same concept used for walls to the roof or ceiling in order to complete the thermal envelope. Roofs and ceilings, especially for low-race buildings and houses, are the most exposed part of the building to vapor flow, air leakage, and hot and cold flow.

For this reason, we always connect the environmental separator EIOS for walls with the environmental separator EIOS for roofs or ceilings.

Solutions are unique for each particular building.

EIOS Thermosystem is created by assembling air/vapor impermeable extruded polystyrene XPS boards, invented to create two sealing joints. These joints allows sealing two times with closed-cell expandable polyurethane foam.

The whole assembly (including intersections with other constructive elements such windows, doors, penetrations, and terminations) will be over-sealed with a special formula of polymer-based sealant material to ensure that no vapor can diffuse through the Thermosystem.

 

A strong and durable reinforcing layer called Lamina is applied over the Vapor-Impermeable Insulation Assembly.  On the Lamina is applied the finishing coat with a desired texture and color to complete the EIOS System.

The envelope wall can be this simple.  Because of its Non-Permissive features, it will achieve the thermal efficiency of complicated, double-layered, expensive, moisture-controlled walls.

The starter-track is sealed to the structure and creates a strong and anti-termite band on the foundation of the construction. The anti-termite band eliminates the usually costly repair needed within a few years of construction because of termite infestation.  Most common types are against the code requirements of drainage and ventilation of the cladding or exterior insulation (drainage and ventilation means a bottom provided opening to the exterior for water to drain and for air intake).

EIOS Thermosystem is also very strong, and does not crack like other hard-coatings.

EIOS System is vital for wooden, moisture-sensitive construction with air/vapor permeability and susceptibility to dampness - timber construction, wooden structure + OSB/plywood or galvanized sheet profiles + sheetrock, and new and retrofit construction.

By contracting EIOS during this campaign, you have a 20-year Stability, Crack-Free Warranty.

While the 20-year Stability and Crack Free Warranty is invaluable, we believe that the Moisture-Free Lifetime Warranty - only available in this campaign - is the most incredible benefit you can have for your house or building investment.

 

EIOS System Projects

 

We want to introduce you the first house built according to the Principle of Avoiding Condensation.  We periodically inspect and monitor it for moisture issues, indoor air quality, and comfort in relation to thermal efficiency.

The house is the dream home of a family with two children, hand crafted by wood with a wonderful spirit of natural living inside.

The project was completed in 2013 and is located in Romania, eastern Europe (equivalent to climate zone 5 in the US).

The specs of the construction includes:

  • timber exterior and interior walls, 12 cm (5 inch), no air-tightness of walls and window/doors intersections;
  • rafters, wainscot apparently on the inside and batten roof decking as roof structure, zero air-tight considered;
  • upstairs attic living space (mansard);
  • EIOS 8System and EIOS 8Sky, 8 cm (about 3 inch) Non-Permissive Insulation, R18 (US Effective R-value) as Environmental Separator;
  • EIOS 8 cm Thermosystem ground floor insulation;
  • two floors of 65 m² (700 ft²) totaling a 130 m² (1400 ft²) interior living space (without walls), enclosed by 450 m² (4850 ft²) thermal envelope (including floor);
  • triple-glazed, low-e high quality windows and doors, representing about 0.1% of the total thermal envelope.

 

After four years of observations of the occupied home, we conclude:

  • the wood structure has a constant moisture content around 11%, the entire house is constantly dry with no condensation or intruding water;
  • no mold grows or other organisms developed in the wood frame and the interior still holds a pleasant smell of pine tree;
  • the heating energy use over five months during winter (equivalent to NY climate zone) is about 30 - 40 kWh/m² (2.8 - 3.7 kWh/ft²) of thermal envelope per annum, including the hot water for four people;
  • the cooling energy for the hot season is zero, the house does not have any air conditioning system on the summer. Inside temperatures slightly rise above comfort for a short period of time during the day, but only for a few days out of the year.

The family living in this house is complete satisfied of its decision, very happy with the comfort and the very low costs of energy bills. They are aware that they could easily made the mistakes of regular construction. They would have ended up in an uninhabitable house in the summer without the help of cooling systems and would have increased their winter energy bills by four times. Plus they would have had to deal with the inevitable mold and fungi that lives in a traditionally-built house. 

The family is now life-long believers in the EIOS system.

 

Soon after inventing the Non-Permissive insulation for wall systems, the inventor realized that this system should apply also for roofs in connection with the walls to complete a building enclosure.

Roofs are always made out of moisture sensitive materials, are made less airtight, and are the most exposed to the vicissitudes of nature.  

This is why the EIOS concept branched out to EIOS Sky, the Non-Permissive insulation system for roofs in 2013.

The most common feature of roofs is that they have very little to no existing air tightness.

If you have the resourceful idea to have a living space in the attic instead of a cold/hot attic, you face the technical dilemma of making the roof more airtight and having moisture accumulation problems or to make in-wall ventilation that lets intentional airflow through the walls to manage moisture but ends up having very less thermal efficiency.

Real construction is somewhere in between, and home owners deals with exposure to toxic indoor molds and pay unreasonably high energy bills.

As a revolutionary solution, EIOS Sky solves all these problems with the Non-Permissive Thermosystem.

 

EIOS Sky is always Non-Permissive-connected with the exterior wall insulation such as the EIOS System. 

The less-airtight roof decking is the perfect substrate for applying EIOS Sky.

EIOS Sky is placed in the best location for protecting the building, which is certainly on the outside of the structure. 

The system creates an insulation shell that eliminates in-wall condensation, drastically reduces the energy demand, and protects from water infiltration, germs, and pollutants.  This results in a reduction to or even elimination of mechanical systems (in not-extreme climates).

 

The structural element (roof frame) uses less material to build, less chemicals to protect for moisture, foils and water/air/vapor barrier is not longer used, the design requirement to accommodating in-wall insulation is eliminated, and this is also an important saving for the investor, and for our natural resources.

The living space can be simply created, natural and pleasant, and always dry and comfortable.

A win for the builder, the owner, and the environment. 

If this concept suits your construction needs, do not hesitate to acquire one of our perks, and you are in for the best journey from solution to completion.

The Moisture-Free Lifetime Warranty also applies to this system.

EIOS Sky Projects

An old building in Bucharest, Romania was remodel and has been given a new look and utility.

The building owner chose to convert the old cold-attic in an office space. Being aware of the moisture and cooling/heating problems that this space will face, he searched for the best solution. He found EIOS.   

On October 2016, the old roof framing was replaced with a new one, and EIOS settled the solution to install the environmental separator - EIOS Sky.

 

Being a massive brick-masonry construction (with walls not sensitive to moisture) the facades ware insulated and finished with the classical face-sealed EIFS, connected with the Non-Permissive EIOS Thermosystem applied on the roof.

During construction and interior finishing, no-condensation water was noticed on the entire roof (regardless the high RH level). It is well known that a roof system containing vapor barrier produces some kg/m² of condensation water in the cold season. Comparing this with not-a-drop on the entire roof, the building owner feels privileged. 

The main visible feature of the new attic was the ease in which it was heated in the winter, and the less running of air-conditioning in the summer.

The owner is very happy with his decision and finds the price of EIOS Sky very affordable and lower than price to build with classical insulation system and moisture control solutions.

The most preferred roof systems in association with EIOS Sky are the Tiled Roof Systems, which ensures good exterior-to-exterior ventilation and a convenient attachment system.

 

On-the-roof insulation is not always suitable for real construction solutions and renovation purposes.

Converting an attic into a nice, comfortable living space or designing the last floor of a building to be a mansard or penthouse is very efficient for living but is also very challenging for moisture control solutions and thermal efficiency.

The main characteristic of attic rooms is that it cannot be inhabited in the summer without air-conditioning and the air clogs because of mold grown in the structure.   

Again, EIOS expands its application domain to be the complete solution for loft conversion and mansards as well.

An old attic with virtually zero air-tightness and exposed to high levels of cold and heat is the perfect place to install EIOS.

The environmental separator EIOS applied to the ceiling will immediately change the indoor environment once installed.

The special sealing ensures a vapor-impermeable insulation and guarantees that the unlimited Zero Condensation, Moisture-Free feature is applied to the entire surface.

EIOS now separates the two environments - your interior living space and the exterior. The roof framing is kept in one environment where in the summer the wood is dried by the heat and in the winter will be sterilized by the cold.

    

The reinforcement layer Lamina creates the perfect support that never cracks, for the plastering finishes.

EIOS Thermosystem again gives you a comfortable and healthy indoor, moisture-free and incredibly thermally efficient space – all lifetime guaranteed.

 

The roof of every house or building accentuates the nobility and charm of the construction, but the attic is not always suitable for living.

We strongly recommend that the living space be separated from the exterior environment by a Non-Permissive Insulation Assembly for moisture-free, high thermal-efficiency reasons. The thermal envelope of the building needs to be connected and completed with the ceiling of the living space.

The ceiling is the area most exposed to vapor-flow and to the thermal-flow from the interior, so a special protection is needed on this part also.

Today’s common practices always leaves the insulation fragmented and with zero airtight capabilities after installed, and the control layers are inexistent or difficult to be applied and very ineffective.

In alternative, we give two options for EIOS Thermosystem applied to ceilings to cover all construction situations:

EIOS for Ceilings with Lamina for direct finishing of the surfaces

or EIOS for Ceilings with an attachment system.

In many situations, the design requires a suspended ceiling to accommodate electrical and mechanical systems.

Also, it is well known that the poorly performing duct system in the cold/hot attic contributes to lost energy, condensation, and mold problems of the air-ducting system. 

 

We solve all those problems by applying a continuous EIOS Thermosystem as the environmental separator on the ceiling, provided with a strong attachment system for the suspended ceiling, and for other mechanical attachments.

All ducting can be installed in the interior conditioned environment with obvious advantages.

 

EIOS for Ceiling Projects

Of the many projects EIOS has, we want to introduce you to one that we did not expect to become a reality so soon.

This project is an eight years old house that has been lived in for five years by a young family with two children. It was extended in 2016 with a living room and a utility room on the ground floor and a master bedroom and a closet room in the upstairs living attic.

The house has two more bedrooms in the attic, so the homeowner knows very well how expensive it is to live in this kind of designed construction, both in winter and in summer. Searching for the best insulation solution for the new part of the house, the owner found EIOS.

In December 2016 an EIOS team installed the Thermosystem on the roof-ceiling and completed it with the Lamina for plastering finishing.

 

The extreme cold outside makes it very expensive to heat the inside, which is heated by a wooden pellets furnace.

After completing the EIOS on the ceiling, something unusual happened: in the extension of the house attic, the temperature inside rises above the rest of the house temperature.  This was only with the heat lost by the furnace downstairs and the insulated chimney flue that passes through the upstairs living space.

The homeowner made a decision: He wanted to remodel the entire house with this new concept. He wanted to have EIOS on the entire roof and ceiling.

In early February 2017, the drywall ceiling of the entire house was demolished and replaced with EIOS Thermosystem.

 

The insulation was already infested with the black mold.

The house uses at least two times less energy for heating in the winter and more than ten times less energy for cooling in the summer. This saving applies while the living space is almost doubled.

 

This campaign is all about how your house or building can be built more thermally efficient with walls containing zero moisture. It will require less money invested, less money in construction costs, and getting a Lifetime Warranty for those features. All of these benefits are available while sustaining a revolutionary way to build for this world. 

EIOS Thermosystem is the perfect solution for everyone who engages in projects involving house/building remodeling, cladding change, home improvement, improving thermal efficiency, and of course anything involved with constructing a new building enclosure.

Please join in spreading the Principle of Avoiding Condensation and participate in adopting and implementing this new principle of technique in practice.

 

Your vote for the new concept. Thank you

All contributors, large and small, will be considered Ambassadors of this new concept of construction and will be mentioned in a Book of Fame that will contain the names of the supporters who contributed within the first 30 days of the start of this campaign.

If you are inspired by this concept and want to have your building made accordingly, you have the opportunity to ask the founders your questions and get answers.

 

  

You will find answers to your building-dilemmas and specific solutions to your moisture problems and much more.

This is for personal enquiries only, not for professional use. 

Please provide your name, location (state, country), and your email address.

For building professionals to avoid struggling with concepts and details on their first attempts, we are here to answer questions. 

   

 

Please provide your name, location (state, country), your email address, profession, company, and position. 

 

Remember that EIOS is engineered specifically for your building and is not something that can be sent or delivered.

For this reason, we offer flexible input perks for those contracting EIOS Thermosystem.

We will move EIOS in the United States this year where it belongs and where it was first invented. 

For all home owners, building owners, designers or builders that want to have the best ever insulation system, contract EIOS during this campaign!

To make things simple and easier to purchase, we offer 5 Perks according to the estimated square-footage of the thermal envelope of the building where EIOS Thermosystem will be applied.

Each Downpayment will represent a 5 to 10 percent of the total contract price for the completion of the project.

The Reservation will be fully deducted from the total contracting price, being considered a down payment, which is normal in construction practice between reliable contractors.

The final price will be calculated from design drawings estimates for the new construction, or from real measurements on retrofitted buildings based on the table following. It contains the price per square-foot according to the project EIOS Thermosystem application (System, Sky, Ceiling) per specific surface, new construction, or renovation. 

 

The total price will be explained and discussed in detail with each building-owner/investor before signing the contract. 

For building remodeling, EIOS will inspect the location, take related measurements, find technical solutions according to the owner’s wishes, EIOS requirements, and work with the designer's demands and builder's schedules.

The discounted total on the contract will stay basically as established with prices per ft² and even discounts on the total price for simple-design projects. However, keep in mind that we will need to add supplemental costs for trims, complicated facades, ornamental joints and bands other than normal code requirements, on-the-roof elements, and details that usually increase any normal construction budget.

As construction professionals, the EIOS team will find the most advantageous way to collaborate with any person participating in the project.

Back Early to lock in an exclusive 100%-Perk discount for your EIOS building/remodeling project. The discount applies to the total price of the contracting project and represents the amount of Perk (your Perk is your 100% saving) for the first three size-category projects 3X5 out of 100.

In addition, for the friends that share our campaign or individuals having more than one project, we offer a 2% discount for the total contracting price for two or more projects closer than 50 miles.  

 

 

We provide all package materials with the best quality and technical characteristics.

 

 

We also provide the technical support and the installation of EIOS for every project.

 

 

We will not charge for estimates and will travel to location for renovation evaluations and solutions. 

 

 

For various types of construction, with walls that are sensitive to wetting and also for carrying out various EIOS behind facade systems, the EIOS specialists are available for finding the complete and personalized technical solution.

The estimating and contracting of EIOS projects will start as soon the campaign ends, but we will contact you earlier than that for information on how to get blueprints from you or your contractors and to get information about the stage of the project, timeline, and location. Most importantly, we will establish the time when the EIOS installation can start.

Order today and build whenever you want!

 

When it comes to insulation, few may know that the actual solutions have two major issues:

  • The vapor diffusion paradigm and moisture accumulation and
  • The low insulation effectiveness of R-value and air-tightness weaknesses of the building.

The two principal issues fully resolved and associated with further EIOS advantages will give you the vision in setting goals that result in benefits.

Applying the Principle of Avoiding Condensation for a healthy home to design, construction, renovation and maintenance do not have to result in cost increases. By understanding the interactions between EIOS and building systems without trade-offs, cost savings combined with building improved performances, we can give a general view of how to save with EIOS Thermosystem.

Here are some special advantages of EIOS Thermosystem over EIFS (the closest insulation system to EIOS):

Any building and home can benefit today from the design technology to eliminate condensation and the use of insulation materials in ideal conditions, for an unlimited term, at the same price as deficient or illusory insulations.

 

The unsolved problem of moisture in the building envelope of every enclosure comes to an end.
By contracting EIOS for your house or building investment, you will be one of the first to own a house with zero moisture in the walls due to harm from the exterior environment.
Water can get in every regular construction by vapor movement and condensation, or via direct entry. EIOS is the first construction system in the world that claims to completely eliminate this issue.   

We all know that every single house/building without exception contains water/air/vapor barriers in the form of foils, fabric, or membranes. Even the European mineral brick wall built houses contain vapor barriers on the roof system. This practice is supposed to solve the problem of moisture in envelope walls by controlling vapor flow and water entry.  

Water passes barriers in different forms but always because of forces in action.
Driving forces can be gravitational, capillarity, wind washing, or pressure forces occurring because of the temperature differences between the conditioned space and the exterior environment (air/vapor pressure differential).
Water gets inside of walls because of those forces in action, but when we want them to dry out, there are no forces to drive water and vapors out of the walls.

 

Of course, this problem is not solved by classical vapor barriers, air/vapor permeable insulations, air flow through walls, drainage or wall-ventilation systems. Water that sill damages buildings is impetuous called: intruding water, incidental water or remnant humidity. In fact, the vapor barrier become a condensation plane in various heat loads along with other materials which acquire a dew point temperature. This vapor barrier always prevents this water from drying.
Drainage-planes also do not work to prevent moisture. Porous materials that absorb water will not drain out until the material is saturated, containing 100% of the humidity which that material can hold. You can imagine what that’s mean for the cladding and exterior insulation…

The results can be seen nearly everywhere, especially when repairs and renovations are required.

This is the reality, but the accepted advice is to follow published regulations and guidance on combining insulation, air barriers, and the permeability of materials for walls to control condensation…

 

Instead, EIOS is custom-made and created on your house/building as an insulation system that is 100% waterproof, 100% airtight and 99.9% vapor-impermeable. This will keep any form of water out of the insulation.

EIOS is consistently vapor-tight when applied to the building, including intersections with windows/doors and other penetrations, so no fluid leakage can occur.  

EIOS complete separates the different environments, so as the structural element of the building is entirely in one environment. Because EIOS is usually installed on the exterior, the supporting structure has the same temperature as the interior vapors, prohibiting condensation. The dew point of the warm moisture-laden air is always inside of the EIOS system, remote from the inner surface, which never become a condensation plane.
Along with the water impermeability and complete air-tightness, the imperviously-created EIOS Thetmosystem solves all moisture issues that can harm your house for an unlimited time, guaranteed.

 

 

The energy efficiency of walls is not only based how much insulation you install, but also on how much the building uses the insulation installed in order to reduce the heat flow.

Besides accumulating condensation/intrusion water and decay, walls are a big waste of energy. Thicker or doubled walls are promoted to support more cavity insulation and to provide places for installing in-wall vapor barriers.   

The wasted money and time used to build those walls and to provide energy to heat or cool the environment comes out of your pocket.

Energy assessment audits are made exclusively by using software. The program used no matter which will simply take the R-value specified for the insulation product used (the laboratory tests for λ, R) and applies it to the building according to the wall measurements. Reduction coefficients are applied only for thermal bridges, solar exposure, etc. and are not realistic for in-cavity convection, around windows, and through the walls phenomenon (looping convection, through insulation convection, infiltration end ex-filtration, reduction of R-value by increasing the humidity content, air flow, etc.). Those phenomenon are the major source of wasting energy, water accumulation, and mold growing in the envelope walls that surround you and the problems are hidden in the case of every cavity. These issues with all the consequences can be extended to every insulation system permeable to water/air/vapors combined with the classical water/air/vapor barrier.

It is very important to understand that in-cavity convection and the related wasting of energy does not depend on the air tightness of the wall construction.

The in-cavity looping convection is generated by the two fronts of air generated by the high thermal conductivity of sheathing, air/vapor barrier, and cladding on the exterior, as well as the gypsum sheathing enclosure on the interior which passes a lot of heat/heat-deficit inside of the walls.

The two fronts of air and the air pressure differential creates air movement, looping of the insulation and direct convection.

 

Insulation becomes an object put inside the walls that does not use its insulation value.

The R-value of insulation is just a laboratory number determined and is not very often applied to the building envelope.

 

We present this case because of two main reasons:

1. With very few exceptions, most people believe that if an insulation is 95% airtight, the insulation will be about 90% effective. In fact, for a 95% air tightness of insulation, the effectiveness of R-value is less than 30% from the specifications of the insulation material installed.

The “leaky pot effect” (see video) makes it easy to understand the energy lost inside of walls because the insulation is not 100% airtight.

2. EIOS was “compared” in thickness with other insulation systems. To achieve code requirements, designers, builders, and home owners know that the building envelope not supposed to fall below a specified R-value, which is transposed in practice in thickness of the insulation and many times in the thickness of the walls in order to achieve the minimal energy efficiency requirements.

With the R-value of 100% effective, a regular 3-inch (7.62 cm) EIOS proves in practice a thermal efficiency above a 1 foot (30 cm) cavity padding insulation.

 

The effectiveness of the thermal envelope R-value of the building is decreased by the air leakage of the walls and the low air tightness of the insulation.

 

The R-100% effectiveness of EIOS Thermosystem makes the difference between Non-Permissive and other permissive insulations.

 

R-effective (the insulation value applied to the building in real construction) is very different than the R-Specified (the insulation value of the insulation material).

 

So in translation, those who ignore these factors and do not choose the correct solution for its thermal insulation system, buys in vain thinking that it can bring a long-term continuous saving. An envelope wall, thermal inefficiency, and exposure to moistening, mold, and degradation can now be replaced with a wall that is extremely efficient, permanently dry, without the hazard of growing mold and degradation. The EIOS wall maintains a pleasant and healthy ambience to the interior.

Code requirements all over the world specify insulation values according to climate zone.

For example, in the US, the code requirements for new construction, roof systems are:

R30 in Miami, FL Hot-Humid climate

R49 in Minneapolis, MN Cold climate (BTU unit system)

 

By comparative observation on real projects, we estimate that an EIOS building envelope will be at least two times more thermally efficient than other buildings that meet standard code requirements. This is estimated on EIOS R17.5, 3 inch (7.62 cm) of Non-Permissive Insulation. Obviously this is not based on the R-numbers. It is a result of poor-effectiveness of air-based, permissive insulations, and of course, by the 100% Effectiveness of EIOS.

Conclusion: Do not compare EIOS with codes and requirements, just because non-permissive insulations are not yet specified by codes.

In the case of the in-cavity installed, air-permeable, air-leaky insulations, the thermal efficiency of the wall is based mostly on the air-layer enclosed in the airtight-cavity (which is not taken into consideration by energy assessment software and pros), and not by using the insulation value and conductivity of the insulation.

If the first goal of EIOS is the elimination of moisture issues, increasing the thermal efficiency of your building all at a lower construction price is just as powerful.

 

 

Before launching the EIOS brand as an integrated concept technology and details to insulate and clad buildings, tests and experiments were made to prove the true attributes and how the product will perform in practice.

 

EOTA is the European Organization for Technical Assessment in the area of construction products, based in Brussels. 

 

What makes homes unhealthy?

Basically speaking, a house is healthy as long as it is dry, but it becomes sick when moisture rises above normal levels.  
When non-permissive insulation was first applied, either experimentally or on actual projects, the primary concern was to verify moisture content in the materials of supporting structure both before and after the insulation system was put to function as an environmental separator for a specific period of time.

When differences of temperature apply, usually the humidity of a wall structure increases during vapor movement from warm to cold and condensation occurs in the cold area of the enclosure walls. 
The nice surprise was that in every case, the humidity of structural materials decreased after heat/cold loads, instead of increasing.
When we made the first experiments on non-permissive insulation, the exciting results revealed the decreasing of wood content humidity when normally a vapor-permeable constructed wall should increase its water content due to condensation.

For the inventor of EIOS, this was the first confirmation that the concept is right and that the system functions better than expected.
Simulation programs reveal water accumulation from condensation in the quantity of 4 kg/m² (about 1 lb/ft²) for almost every wall configuration in a continental climate (non-extreme climate) on every cold season of the year.
Comparing this with zero condensation and an actual decrease of moisture content, we believe that this is the best option for your structure.

At first the inventor founds this phenomenon baffling and named the effect Unidirectional Drying.
Later, the explanation for this phenomenon became clear that a low heat flow passes through the non-permissive insulation without allowing any vapor to pass through. This small amount of heat creates a difference in temperatures from the surface of sheathing right behind insulation and the exterior environment, and other cold materials.

This temperature difference makes existent vapors move and water to evaporate.
After finding this explanation, the inventor called it the Drying Effect.

Two situations are identified, depending on the thermal flow relative to the structural element of a non-permissive insulation:

  • when the structure is on the side with the thermal flow and
  • when the structure is on the opposite side from the heat flow.

The video presents the physical phenomenon that creates the Drying Effect in the situation when the Structural Element is on the cold side of the separated environments.

 

Some people that have benefited from the EIOS advantages call this phenomenon the "EIOS Effect". 

The Drying Effect is not yet a certitude as the Avoiding Condensation phenomenon, but it is still an observation of facts and empirically given explanations.
We hope with your support to have more funds for research in this new field of building science. We also hope that more institutions, laboratories, and even authorities will join our effort to implement the Zero Moisture Concept.

 

 

Why EIOS needs help

 

There are two main reasons why EIOS needs crowd support.

 

One is that the construction industry and building science is too well set in their ways with the current moisture control practice. The Avoiding Condensation concept involves a drastic change in mentality, which is not easy after thousands of years of building according to the techniques of merely controlling water, air, and vapors in buildings. More than this, by following the building codes, everyone involved in construction is absolved of responsibility, even if they know that more or less, sooner or later buildings will end up having moisture problems.

So, why should we make a change, and who needs to?

So far, except for a few building owners that understand the problem/solution, we could not find any builder or architect to adopt this new concept and use this new product on its buildings.

The next problem is to have the XPS extruded polystyrene EIOS Sealboard invented to suit’s the needs of double-sealing with polyurethane foam, manufactured in this shape by the industry producer.

We need projects using an industrial-producing amount of XPS, so the producer will modify its production line and only charge the conventional marketable price.

So far all EIOS projects were made by hand cutting every edge of insulation board. This is very labor extensive, and EIOS cannot afford to install it in the U.S. at a competitive price.

Our marketing strategy is to provide all package materials with the best quality and technical characteristics, as well as to provide the technical support and installation of EIOS for every project.

Every product in construction has an installation contractor that is more or less trained by the producer. EIOS is a new type of construction in many ways, so projects cannot be given to inexperienced contractors because failing is not an option.

Every project contracted through this campaign will be directly planned and led by trained specialists, and the inventor of this new concept will be available for all EIOS applications.

We face the common problems of startup lack of capital and slow marketing.

While preparing the EIOS brand to launch, our full-featured product for early adopters is an entire construction fitted with the new insulation system.  

 

Risks and Challenges

 

We believe that while we have projects totaling 20,000 ft² and above in the U.S. the challenge will be to make the perfect job on every single project.

So far there have been no errors or defects of any kind on any EIOS project, and this is because of the high standards of the team members on the site and the direct guidance of the inventor. By contracting EIOS during this campaign, contractors will benefit directly for their contribution and effort.

EIOS will take the projects from this launching campaign on its own, to get each team ready to install the product, for the best quality control on providing materials, solutions, detailing, site organization, and workmanship.

This is not a simple task, but we have prepared teams of people with many years of experience in this field to help switch to the new concept.   

Not many future EIOS projects will get this much attention and the Moisture Free Lifetime Warranty. 

 

Experience you can trust

If you could not find what you are looking for here, please check our website or contact us through info@eios.co

Join us in redefining thermal insulation!
story_txt:
EIOS is the first insulation in the world that offers a cladding and finishing system that completely eliminates the condensation phenomenon in the building envelope (the exterior walls of every building that separate the interior conditioned space from the exterior environment) by applying in practice a new concept of creating Vapor-Impermeable Insulation Systems, called Non-Permissive Insulations.

EIOS is made out of high-quality Extruded Polystyrene XPS with joints invented for double-sealing with polyurethane foam and an over-sealing with polymer material. The XPS is a vapor-impermeable insulation material. By vapor sealing all joints and intersections with other objects (windows, doors, etc.), we create a vapor-impermeable insulation assembly, the Non-Permissive Insulation.
Condensation is avoided when vapors are prevented from passing through an insulation assembly that has been applied to an enclosure that separates two environments with different temperatures.
The basic theory of this new concept is expressed by the newly discovered Principle of Avoiding Condensation.

 
From ancient times when people started building shelters until the present, construction has been done in the same way – with the idea of controlling unwanted factors such water, air, vapors, and thermal flow. This EIOS campaign will change this field though.
Contemporary construction has been relatively successful in controlling water, air, and thermal flow in the building envelope. However, the vapor control, dew point and condensation in the envelope walls have left builders in a precarious position. 
The current type of design and construction of envelope walls attempts to control moisture by reducing condensation and by creating the possibility for the walls to dry out. Some of the techniques used include leaving intentional airflow through the walls, utilizing drainage plans, and providing ventilation of the insulation.
While the Moisture Control concept is based on cycles of wetting and drying from season to season and makes use of vapor barriers, the Moisture Free concept is based on the complete elimination of the condensation phenomenon by creating Non-Permissive Insulations.

Those revolutionary inventions, the Principle of Avoiding Condensation and the Non-Permissive Insulation need your support and acceptance to be a current practice. 
 
 
The majority of people think that the actual design and realization of envelope walls is based on Avoiding the Condensation Phenomenon, but in reality it is based on Moisture Control and Managing Condensation by applying water/air/vapor barriers, creating drainage planes, and ventilation of walls.The functioning of an envelope wall is based on cycles of wetting and drying, by accumulating humidity from condensation when the inside-outside temperature differences apply and by naturally drying the walls. The wetting of the envelope walls occurs when the inside of a structure is heated because of the outdoor colder temperatures.  It also happens when a building is cooled inside, and the outside environment is hot and humid. In cold or hot/humid climates, the heating and cooling of a building is virtually all four seasons, with only short periods of time when air/vapor driving forces are not applied to the wall. This cumulative, short period of time when condensation does not occur is just not enough time to dry the water accumulated, mainly due to the air/vapor barrier layers applied. The consequence is the occurrence of dampness, mold, and degradation such as wood rot and corrosion.
 
In regular continental climates, the quantity of condensation water accumulated in a cold season (90 days) is about 1 lbs/ft² (3-6 kg/m²) and dries in 80-160 days, meaning a cycle of water accumulation and drying.
In cold or hot climates, the quantity of water can easily double, the wetting period increases, the drying necessary time exceeds the period of the drying season, and moisture accumulates.
The consequence is well known: the beginning of interstitial (in the wall) mold grown, degradation of indoor air quality, fast decay of envelope walls, expensive repairs and lowering of property value.

 
While the entire world builds according to principles of Moisture Control, EIOS is our proposal to start building without moisture, based on the Principle of Avoiding Condensation.
 

Each of us lives in a house or building that must maintain a comfortable temperature and humidity level. Those conditions create differences of temperatures and relative humidity which in turn generates driving forces for energy flow and air/vapor movement. Temperature differences also generate dew point and condensation with the related consequences resulting in mold and degradation.While the energy flow can be slowed down by adding real insulation value, the condensation phenomenon had no solution before the invention of the Principle of Avoiding Condensation.

A New Principle of Technology which enables the design of envelope walls without condensation.
One of the goals of this campaign is to share this new technical principle with the world. This allows builders to construct building enclosures that have completely eliminated the condensation phenomenon, the cycles of wetting and drying, mold, and degradation within envelope walls.


People involved in construction can attest to the fact that, when it comes to vapor transfer, condensation, mold, and consequences our actual prescriptive requirements for moisture control depend on the “vapor diffusion paradigm” and not on scientists’ default and reproducible experiments.                                            
The actual fundamental principle to control water in vapor form is to keep it out and to let it out if it happens to gets into the wall. Another common principle is to encourage drying mechanisms over wetting prevention mechanisms. This gets complicated because sometimes the best strategies to keep water vapor out actually end up trapping water vapor in, plus varying climates and seasons make this even more complicated. If using these principles, there needs to be different strategies for different climates. There also has to be consideration for the differences between summer and winter if following this principle, but this is rather impossible.
All these stipulations lead to legitimate question:
Is there a situation, configuration, or assembly that could avoid the condensation completely despite the climate or season? Can we have a general rule to use as a principle to avoid condensation in building enclosures and other such enclosures?
The answer is YES, and it makes the object of the new theory of Non-Permissive Insulation. The Principle of Avoiding Condensation can be formulated, understood, and used in designing and constructing enclosures. The value of this principle is obvious.
As a basic fundamental of science, the Principle of Avoiding Condensation is defined as:
When there is a temperature difference and an enclosure is interposed between the high interior temperature and the low exterior temperature (or vice versa), in order to avoid condensation, the heat flow needs to convert the cold flow in an insulation material or in a thermo-insulation assembly without vapor diffusion or any air/vapor flow that carries warm vapor towards cold areas.

After a deep understanding of the phenomenology and configuration of Vapor Impermeable Insulation or Non-Permeable Insulation Assemblies, the Principle of Avoiding Condensation can have a simple definition:
The condensation is avoided when the heat flow converts the cold flow in a Vapor Impermeable Insulation or a Non-Permissive Insulation Assembly. 
Please download the pdf and share with your friends:
https://eios.co/principles-of-avoiding-condensa...
Be the first to read, understand, support, and implement this theory – it will change the thinking of how to construct walls and buildings.
So, the philosophy of this new Principle is that heat has to meet the cold in an insulation material or system without the presence of any vapors. By achieving this, the warm environment is "stopped" on the warm surface of the insulation, which is a condensation-free plane, because is in a dew-point free area.
  
By applying this theory in practice, the engineer Marius Radoane invented a Thermal Insulation and Finishing System which eliminates all problems of condensation, intruding or absorbed water, and in certain situations, the wall that receives this system dries to an unexpected humidity level, by simply applying a difference of temperature. This revolutionary design was first called “Non-Permissive Exterior Insulation and Finishing System (NP-EIFS)” and was invented as an integrated Concept, Technology, and Details to function in all real construction situations.
The actual promoters of wall systems teach us that a 30-40% humidity in the wood frame and drywall is normal. However these buildings have a short lifespan and lots of problems.
By applying the Principle of Avoiding Condensation materialized in the Design Technology to Eliminate Condensation we created EIOS (Exterior Insulation Over Specified). We bring to the world the first high insulated wall system that dries and stays dry in all environmental situations, providing an alternative to the breathing, wetting, and energy flow walls.
A new age of high-performance building envelope starts with the Principle of Avoiding Condensation, the theory of Non-Permissive Insulation, to which all can benefit.
More details on our campaign and proofs of how EIOS technology works please visit https://eios.co/
 

We are proud to introduce the first insulation and finish system that completely eliminates the condensation phenomenon on envelope walls. This is an integral solution to clad and insulate a building that guarantees permanently dry walls, no dampness, mold, fungi or degradation, as well as thermal efficiency Real R-value equal to the specified value of the insulation materials used.
EIOS high performance rendering is not possible without an integrated system between Concept, Technology, and Details that have been integrated to achieve the final goal.

The Zero Condensation Concept is the idea of eliminating the condensation phenomenon and intruding water. It also solves the problem of decreasing the specified thermal efficiency of insulation materials and/or partially applying the insulation value to envelope walls. All these things are only possible by applying the Principle of Avoiding Condensation and the theory of Non-Permissive Insulation.
Technology is created to achieve the Concept Goal. Regardless of how good a technology is, and what performance products uses, if the Concept does not stand up, the product results will fails.
A good cladding technology will also fail if the details of intersections with other constructive elements are deficient and not in accordance with the concept goal.
EIOS Technology provides insulation and triple sealing of every joint of insulation boards and intersection with other construction elements such as windows, doors, and other openings on the structure’s interior facing towards the exterior.

Detail Solutions are unique for each particular building.
These details form an integral part of EIOS technology to achieve the goal of avoiding condensation.
 

After six years of experimentation, applications, improvements, enlarging of scopes, observations, measurements of results, and patenting, we can give a close look at EIOS features:

 

All those benefits arise from the philosophy of avoiding condensation, and EIOS is the first one in the field to utilize this concept.
When contracting EIOS, you have all those benefits under one lifetime warranty.
 


EIOS System is the most advanced cladding, insulation and finishing system that you can have for your house or building investment, with a real distance from anything else you can find, relating functionality, durability and quality.

With the Zero Moisture feature for the thermal-envelope walls for an unlimited time, we give a Lifetime Warranty that your house will be dry and healthy. The Moisture Free warranty applies to any way in which the exterior environment can cause moisture by condensation, even including any form of intruding water.
EIOS System comes with an attractive stucco appearance and can accept any architectural design, color, and finishes.
 A special price is available only with this campaign. It includes all material, scaffolding for low-rise constructions, exterior finishing, completion of the job, and EIOS Warranty.      
We consider it imperative to apply the same concept used for walls to the roof or ceiling in order to complete the thermal envelope. Roofs and ceilings, especially for low-race buildings and houses, are the most exposed part of the building to vapor flow, air leakage, and hot and cold flow.
For this reason, we always connect the environmental separator EIOS for walls with the environmental separator EIOS for roofs or ceilings.

Solutions are unique for each particular building.
EIOS Thermosystem is created by assembling air/vapor impermeable extruded polystyrene XPS boards, invented to create two sealing joints. These joints allows sealing two times with closed-cell expandable polyurethane foam.

The whole assembly (including intersections with other constructive elements such windows, doors, penetrations, and terminations) will be over-sealed with a special formula of polymer-based sealant material to ensure that no vapor can diffuse through the Thermosystem.

 
A strong and durable reinforcing layer called Lamina is applied over the Vapor-Impermeable Insulation Assembly.  On the Lamina is applied the finishing coat with a desired texture and color to complete the EIOS System.
The envelope wall can be this simple.  Because of its Non-Permissive features, it will achieve the thermal efficiency of complicated, double-layered, expensive, moisture-controlled walls.

The starter-track is sealed to the structure and creates a strong and anti-termite band on the foundation of the construction. The anti-termite band eliminates the usually costly repair needed within a few years of construction because of termite infestation.  Most common types are against the code requirements of drainage and ventilation of the cladding or exterior insulation (drainage and ventilation means a bottom provided opening to the exterior for water to drain and for air intake).
EIOS Thermosystem is also very strong, and does not crack like other hard-coatings.
EIOS System is vital for wooden, moisture-sensitive construction with air/vapor permeability and susceptibility to dampness - timber construction, wooden structure + OSB/plywood or galvanized sheet profiles + sheetrock, and new and retrofit construction.
By contracting EIOS during this campaign, you have a 20-year Stability, Crack-Free Warranty.
While the 20-year Stability and Crack Free Warranty is invaluable, we believe that the Moisture-Free Lifetime Warranty - only available in this campaign - is the most incredible benefit you can have for your house or building investment.
 
EIOS System Projects We want to introduce you the first house built according to the Principle of Avoiding Condensation.  We periodically inspect and monitor it for moisture issues, indoor air quality, and comfort in relation to thermal efficiency.
The house is the dream home of a family with two children, hand crafted by wood with a wonderful spirit of natural living inside.

The project was completed in 2013 and is located in Romania, eastern Europe (equivalent to climate zone 5 in the US).
The specs of the construction includes:

timber exterior and interior walls, 12 cm (5 inch), no air-tightness of walls and window/doors intersections;
rafters, wainscot apparently on the inside and batten roof decking as roof structure, zero air-tight considered;
upstairs attic living space (mansard);
EIOS 8System and EIOS 8Sky, 8 cm (about 3 inch) Non-Permissive Insulation, R18 (US Effective R-value) as Environmental Separator;
EIOS 8 cm Thermosystem ground floor insulation;
two floors of 65 m² (700 ft²) totaling a 130 m² (1400 ft²) interior living space (without walls), enclosed by 450 m² (4850 ft²) thermal envelope (including floor);
triple-glazed, low-e high quality windows and doors, representing about 0.1% of the total thermal envelope.


 
After four years of observations of the occupied home, we conclude:

the wood structure has a constant moisture content around 11%, the entire house is constantly dry with no condensation or intruding water;
no mold grows or other organisms developed in the wood frame and the interior still holds a pleasant smell of pine tree;
the heating energy use over five months during winter (equivalent to NY climate zone) is about 30 - 40 kWh/m² (2.8 - 3.7 kWh/ft²) of thermal envelope per annum, including the hot water for four people;
